title: Technical Analyst
description:
Eagle is currently seeking a Technical Analyst for a twelve (12) month contract position, scheduled to begin immediately.Key ResponsibilitiesThe successful candidate will be responsible for:Leading the system analysis, design, development, implementation, integration and configuration of Health IT systems; Working with the various stakeholders (Business Teams, Project Managers, Application Support Teams, DBAs, vendors, other development teams, etc.) to ensure successful implementation; Adhering to design principles and information standards from the Strategy;Planning & helping the Solution Services Group and contributing design ideas to the Blueprint; Completing the functional requirements analysis to identify information, procedures and decision flows; Ensuring that secure application design and coding requirements are being met for ongoing release maintenance and support and,Completing all assigned development and maintenance tasks (service requests, releases, incidents, problems, etc.).Skills and QualificationsThe successful candidate must have:A University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline; an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered; A minimum of six (6) years of relevant and progressive experience;Experience in developing and managing the implementation of technical solutions in an operational environment; Experience in architecture where multiple systems and domains need be considered from an enterprise view; Experience with large software systems consisting of web interfaces, batch processes, time-based transactions, long-running transactions and multiple integration points; Experience with system performance analysis and optimization; Experience with database design for Oracle and SQL Server; Experience with JAVA; Experience with the .Net Framework and,Experience with HL7 messaging standards.Don't miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

title: Head of Product
description:
Full-Time Position - Greater Toronto Area (GTA) Hiring a full-time Head of Product in Greater Toronto Area (GTA), ON! This role will be primarily responsible for owning ad driving overall product roadmap and vision. In this position, you will come up with new formats and consistently optimize existing product/market fit to maximise audience engagement, retention and minimize churnHot Job Facts* Work in a collaborative, fun work culture* Fast-paced environment using cutting edge technology* Listed as one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies To Work For”Main Responsibilities* Own and drive overall product roadmap and vision* Come up with new formats and consistently optimize existing product/market fit to maximise audience engagement, retention and minimize churn* Partner with marketing, care, and development teams to design and bring to market new capabilities that solve important customer concerns* Lead and develop the product team building core experiences* Positively moving all metrics that relate to audience engagement, retention and growth* Own the product lifecycle from requirements gathering through production and releaseRequired Qualifications & Background* Experience as Head of Product / Director or a similar role* At least 8+ years of experience designing and delivering world-class software products* Demonstrated ability to develop and communicate a big-picture vision and strategy and the passion and detail orientation to drive the details of execution* Proficiency in successful implementation of lean product management.* Experience leading cross-functional teams that together launch on-time and on-budget SaaS software product offerings* Experience with Agile development methodology* BS in Computer Engineering or Computer Science, MBA preferred or equivalent work experienceWe Are An Equal Opportunity EmployerAll qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.Canadian Work AuthorizationAll applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.

title: UNIX SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR
description:
UNIX SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR | Monster.com


















































 UNIX SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR at CGI Info Systems Mgmt Cons Inc.
 
Ottawa, ON













About the Job

 UNIX SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR Position Description CGI currently has a long term contract opportunity for a UNIX System Administrator in the Ottawa area.  Our client has a requirement for a Unix/Linux Specialist to participate in all phases of the project cycle, including implementing the required information technologies, providing technical knowledge, creativity and a seasoned perspective to the projects and to the teams.  The successful candidate will possess the following skills and experience; Your future duties and responsibilities •	Migration of RHEL 5 server to RHEL7•	Enterprise Application Integration Server Renewal•	Cisco switch ever greening (validation of RHEL and Solaris servers)•	Install, configuration and tuning of Solaris 11 servers using OVM•	Install, configuration and tuning of RHEL 7 servers using Satellite server•	Apply patch to Unix and Linux servers•	Produce build books•	Input to operation guides•	Assist in debugging issue during the project cycle.•	Participate in CFIA (Component Failure Impact Analysis) testing•	Transfer knowledge to operations team Required qualifications to be successful in this role •	College diploma or university degree in a technology-related field •	A minimum of seven (7) years’ experience with System administration •	A minimum of five (5) years’ experience with 10 Solaris 10/11 •	A minimum of three (3) years’ experience with Red Hat Linux 5/6/7 •	Demonstrated experience with build automation (Scripting, Packaging, Jumpstart, Kickstart, OpsCenter)•	Demonstrated experience with Sun Clustering•	Demonstrated experience with Solaris Container (Zones)•	Demonstrated experience with storage and networking•	Demonstrated experience with Sun/Oracle Server hardware support •	Knowledge of:o	RHEL Satellite serverso	VMWareAssets:•	Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA)•	Oracle Solaris System Administrator ProfessionalOther Requirements:•	Ability to meet our client's Enhanced Reliability Clearance requirements •	English essential  At CGI, we’re a team of builders. We call our employees members because all who join CGI are building their own company - one that has grown to 68,000 professionals located in 40 countries. Founded in 1976, CGI is a leading IT and business process services firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients - and for our members. Come grow with us. Learn more at  This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit participation and stock purchase plans.We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No unsolicited agency referrals please.CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs. title: Senior Full Stack Developer - Front End
description:
We are looking for a top-notch Senior​ Full Stack Developer​ - Front End​ who is eager tojoin a relatively young, but established business which is well-positioned to disrupt thetechnology used by Financial Advisors in Canada.Your deep knowledge and proven experience in Javascript, jQuery framework andAngular JS, HTML5, CSS3, Amazon AWS hosting administration, and Agile/Scrumprocesses should be evident.We offer an informal work environment but with a "just do it" attitude. We are seekingpeople that are passionate about development, take pride and ownership in their work,and know how to work with others. We respect our team members and are seeking thevery best talent to assist us at this important stage to bring our product to the next level.This role is primarily in Toronto and remote and onsite work schedules are available.We are considering hiring one or more people depending on experience and skill mix anddevelopment priorities.Responsibilities:- Build on a current Production SaaS environment and bring our future UI/UXdesigns to life for an awesome web and mobile browser app experience- Design, develop, and deploy of Angular-Based Web Application- Fluent with the administration of Amazon AWS and CloudFlare platforms- Develop with current security and data protection schemes as paramount- In addition or alternatively, assist with design, development, and deployment ofmobile applications in both Android and iOS- Work alongside other full stack and mobile developers and assist in helping tomerge and deploy releases- Provide technical guidance and expertise to team and mentor junior developers- Document software after development for business useEducation and Experience- Minimum 4 years of relevant experience- 4 or more years working within an Agile/Scrum team- Strong technical skills including expertise in HTML 5 and CSS3- Experience in Web Design, Responsive Design, UX Design and Mobile FriendlyWeb Design- Experience with Javascript, jQuery framework and Angular JS- Experience with GitHub- Strong communication skills (you need to be able to communicate your ideas clearly to both your colleagues and our customers)- A high level of accuracy and quality awareness- Full working proficiency in English- Enthusiasm for e-commerce, online solutions and related technologies- Knowledge and experience with Amazon AWS services and message queues- Experience building API-driven systems and mapping between disparate systemsRequired Experience- Full Stack Development (Front End): 4 years- Agile/Scrum process: 4 yearsNice to Have Experience- Experience with Wordpress Development and Administration- Experience with .net webhooks- Experience with chat-bot technology a plus- Experience with machine learning a plus- Certifications in related technical fields a plus- Mobile application development experience a plusRole Details- Salary commensurate with experience and skillset- Job Type: Full-TimeRandstad Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach her/his potential. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification.As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Randstad Canada will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact your Randstad Recruiter/Consultant about your needs, and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

title: Admin Coordinator
description:
Are you detail-oriented? Do you like to learn on the fly? Can you manage multiple projects? Eagle needs those skills and your “can-do” attitude! We are a busy Canadian recruitment and placement firm with a prestigious client list and a national presence, supported by superior business processes and technology.Our Toronto office has an immediate opening for an Admin Coordinator. This position has a National scope and provides support for the Sales and Recruitment teams. You will handle a multitude of tasks ranging from managing databases and preparing reports to executing ongoing projects. To be successful in our dynamic environment you must have outstanding communication and organizational skills, a keen eye for detail, and use a hands-on approach.Work in one of 2017’s Certified “Best Workplaces in Canada"— our environment is friendly and fast-paced.  If that’s not enough, join a team that focuses on learning, teamwork and fun, and who always give their personal best – you’ll love to be a part of it!  Key ResponsibilitiesThe successful candidate will:Maintain accurate database records;Create, organize and execute regular reports;Data analysis and assistance with strategic project planning;Work with team on a variety of special projects;Provide back-up administrative support for VMS and National resources; andPerform other duties and responsibilities as required.Skills and QualificationsThe successful candidate will have a positive attitude and possess:Post-secondary education in Business Administration, or equivalent;Minimum 1-2 years’ experience working in an office environment;Technology-savvy, with an extensive working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite;Excellent interpersonal, writing and communication skills;Ability to undertake self-directed tasks;Ability to be flexible and work in a rapidly developing environment;Proven attention to detail and high level of accuracy; andHandle sensitive and confidential information requiring a high level of discretion.Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

title: Managed IT Services Site Manager
description:
Long View. A career that helps you get more out of life.A Long View career helps you get more out of life. We don’t just say it, we prove it. Every day. We’re proud of our reputation as one of North America’s most dynamic IT providers — and we’re even prouder of our culture that allows our people to live life to its fullest. At Long View, we create an environment of collaboration and support, of innovation and enthusiasm. As a member of the Long View team, you’ll see how our company’s core pillars — Integrity, Competence, Value, and Fun — resonate through the workplace. And you’ll be recognized and rewarded for your innovation, effort, and enthusiasm. Just a job? Not on your life. Long View is seeking a driven and customer – oriented Managed IT Services (MITS) Site Manager for our Toronto office! As a Site Manager, you will align the delivery of services with Long View’s core values and our clients’ expectations to ensure a healthy IT environment. As the front line representative for Long View, you will interact directly with our clients and our MITS Systems Consultants. You also work directly with Account Managers and the Procurement Team to provide quotes as well as escalate client side opportunities for potential projects.What You Can ExpectGreat People and Culture – A practical approach to business with no bureaucracy or red tape. An environment of collaboration and support. Career Growth – Permanent staff positions, paid training, career life planning, and relocation and travel opportunities.Interesting Work – Be part of exciting projects while accessing all the latest technologies.Flexible Environment – A workplace that values the importance of flexibility for personal/professional growth, happiness and wellness.What You’ll Bring3-5 years of experience in an Infrastructure Generalist or Systems Administrator roleExperience with Windows Server 2003, 2008R2, 2012R2 Active Directory, and XP – Win 7 operating systemsOperational familiarity with Exchange 2007, 2010 and some exposure to Exchange 2013 would be  beneficialExperience and understanding of managing Cisco routers, firewalls, and general networking. Solid knowledge of TCP/IP and WAN ManagementExperience working with storage solutions, or a solid understanding of enterprise storage conceptsOperational knowledge of leading virtualization platform: VMWare ESXi, VSphere and Microsoft HyperVKnowledge of monitoring and maintaining systems and the ability to ensure their optimal performanceKnowledge of IT security tools, as well as exposure to Remedy is considered an assetPost-secondary technical educationMicrosoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE) or Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP) certifications are preferredLife is too short for just any job. Get more out of life with a career at Long View!Long View’s mission of building the best and most sustainable organization, in which our people have healthy lives and prosperous careers requires the best qualified people. To ensure this, we pride ourselves on a culture which fosters inclusive relationships, open communication which ensures reasonable accommodation, and diversity on all fronts.For more information please send an e-mail to Long View Systems at  and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

title: Senior Manager, Technical Infrastructure
description:
The Senior Manager, Technical Infrastructure’s role is to supervise and ensure the efficient operation of the hospital’s compute, storage, and Data Centre infrastructure. This includes managing the IT staff, and responsibility for monitoring and diagnosing network and hardware problems.The Senior Manager, Technical Infrastructure will also work closely with the IT executive staff, decision makers and peers in other departments in order to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support cost-effective technology solutions for all aspects of the hospital. Here’s What You’ll Get To DoDevelop business case justifications and cost/benefit analysis for IT infrastructure spending and initiativesLead IT department operational planning and projects, and organize and negotiate the allocation of IT resources. Work with stakeholders to define business and system requirements for new technology implementationsOversee all reports and documentation related to network and systems operationsAdheres to strong change control procedures and documentationDevelop maintenance schedules for infrastructure assetsBe available for planned maintenance during off hours and weekendProactive communication on all critical business impacting situationsEnsure strong system uptime and performanceImplement a basic ITAM (IT Asset Management) in place for  IT hardware, software, and equipment in the Data CentreDevelop strategies and technology roadmaps to evolve the solutions and infrastructure to align with the technology needs of the organization and increase the value of the IT investment, and implement those strategiesApprove purchase orders for IT equipment and supplies in order to meet operational requirements of the hospitalManage and leverage vendor and partner relationships to gain insight into technology solutions, leverage their knowledge, and maintain cost effective solutionsDevelop best practices, managing service level agreements (internal and external), develop quality standards, establish governance and comply with regulatory/ministry requirementsDrive outstanding business results through traditional management functions including, but not limited to, sourcing and selecting talent, coaching and development, work force and project scheduling, performance management, and general talent planningConduct research and remain current with the latest technologies and solutions in support of procurement effortsDeliver exceptional service by increasing performance and meeting SLA targetsHere's What You'll NeedBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field; or related work experience5+ years’ experience leading and managing IT Operations and Infrastructure teams2+ years hands on administration experience with Microsoft Azure is required4+ years’ experience managing and configuring virtualization technologiesAbility to collaborate and present technology solutions and roadmaps at all levels of the organization up to C-SuiteStrong financial management skills in budgeting, forecasting, and cost controlExpertise knowledge with Active Directory, Exchange 2010/2013, DNS, IPSEC VPNs, IP Switching, and Microsoft domains Expertise knowledgeGeneral knowledge of UNIX and Linux sysadmin skillsFamiliar with leading industry standard concepts, best practices, and routine procedures related to the installation, configuration, management, and health of server and network based systemsAbility to utilize productivity tools to create reports and presentations to provide project status and system performance information to leadersWAN/LAN/Telecom design and administration experience preferredSignificant experience with Office365 migrations a plusDemonstrates a fundamental understanding of integrations and reference architectureOutstanding problem-solving skillsA process-improvement driven attitudeExcellent verbal and written communications skillsEmployment Type:Full-Time, PermanentThis position offers full benefits including health and dental coverage, vacation time, sick time, personal days, LTD, life insurance and the opportunity to participate in the SickKids Pension plan.TO APPLY:

title: Senior Performance Engineer
description:
VTRAC Consulting Corporation Job Application for Senior Performance Engineer | Monster.com















































 Senior Performance Engineer at VTRAC Consulting Corporation
 
Toronto, ON













About the Job

VTRAC  Consulting Corporation“Solutions  for Growth” Please  e-mail your resume as a MS-WORD document in confidence Subject: Performance Engineer, JOB No. 7923,  Attention: Job  No.:                         7923Position:                      Sr. Performance  EngineerPosition  Type:             PermanentNo.  of Positions:         1Location:                      GTA, ON We  are looking for a Performance Engineer who will be responsible for SDLC &  Architecture, Performance validation (profiling, tuning, workload simulation,  benchmarking & testing), Capacity Planning, Application Performance  Monitoring and problem detection and resolution. This position will work  closely with the development engineering and product development teams to  understand the performance and other non-functional requirements on projects. Responsibilities:   ·          Execute  Performance Engineering and analyzing the results and making recommendations, activities  in SDLC leveraging Agile methodology·          Solid  background in different technologies and understand why the performance issue  occurred and how to resolve it·          Create,  re-factor, extend, and maintain performance test scripts·          Help  determine appropriate metrics to be gathered during performance testing and be  responsible for analyzing and tracking against these performance testing  metrics on an ongoing basis·          Help  determine appropriate benchmarks for performance and be responsible for  analysis and tracking against these benchmarks·          Design  and implement performance, scalability, stability, and stress tests using  industry standard tools and custom solutions·          Assist  in driving the performance,scalability, and capacity testing strategy·          Gather  performance test requirements and create performance qualification plans·          Collaborate  with development and production support teams on identification of bottlenecks  and performance tuning·          Benchmark  Production and Test Labs for baselining and ensure accuracy of test simulation·          Develop  tools to simulate and monitor key performance metrics as needed·          Communicate  test results vs. test schedule and test plans Skills &  Knowledge:  ·          Minimum 5+ years of practical experience in  performance engineering (not just performance testing)·          Performance validation (application profiling,  tuning, workload simulation, benchmarking & testing), capacity planning,  application performance monitoring and problem detection and resolution·          Experience with Application Performance Management  (APM), AppDynamics, Visual Studio Load Test·          Expert in definition of non-functional requirements  (NFRs) and validation of NFRs in architecture, design, build phases·          2+ years of experience with load testing tools  (Microsoft Visual Studio, JMeter, ·          2+ years of experience with application and system  profiling tools (DTrace, AQtime, JProfiler or equivalent)·          Experience with Azure or Amazon Cloud based  environment is a plus·          Experience with Microsoft technology stack, visual  studio, TFS is a plus We thank all candidates in advance. Only  selected candidates for interviews will be contacted. For other exciting  opportunities, please visit us at . VTRAC is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Oracle Programmer/Developer/Analyst
description:

title: Java Developer
description:
Randstad is on the hunt for a Java Developer to add to their team for an exciting opportunity in our Downtown office. The ideal individual will be driven and well versed in Design, develop and test a large-scale, custom distributed software system using latest Java and Big data technologies. We will require the selected candidate to employ Agile development practices including test and deployment automation as well as Continuous Integration using Jenkins to improve overall execution speed and product quality. The ideal developer will be well versed with Java technologies and ecosystem: Java (6-8), Spring Suite, Maven, jUnit. You should be proficient using CI and automated testing tools such as Jenkins, Selenium. An added bonus would be having relative work experience with Hadoop or understanding of its components (HDFS, Pig, Hive, HBase, Spark).Randstad Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach her/his potential. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification.As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Randstad Canada will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact your Randstad Recruiter/Consultant about your needs, and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

title: Linux Systems & Infrastructure Administrator
description:
Linux Systems & Infrastructure Administrator | Monster.com















































 Linux Systems & Infrastructure Administrator at Randstad
 
Montreal, QC













About the Job

Linux Systems/Infrastructure Administrator Mandate:  	Linux Systems & Infrastructure AdministratorLocation:   	MontrealDuration:    	12 Months (Possible renewal, possible permanent)Supports, monitors, tests, and troubleshoots all hardware and software related to Linux environment. Works with outside vendors as well as internal engineering team to deliver new systems and services as well as ensure system uptime is within the defined SLA for all systems. Responsibilities: • Responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. • Develop and execute testing plans to ensure configuration changes, software upgrades, and patches are thoroughly tested and documented in the test environment before being implemented in production. • Build and maintain test, development, QA, and production environments to support the application life cycle. • Provide guidance for security best practices as they relate to Red Hat Linux and CentOS. • Develop and execute plans for monitoring of all systems and applications in the production environment to ensure optimum system performance and availability. • Perform regular monitoring and evaluate the Linux environment to ensure system capacity is in line with the corporate demand for services. • Participate in the successful transition of services to support staff. • Research and report industry trends in applications, security, and system maintenance to ensure the system is meeting standards for performance, functionality, security, and reliability. • Provide training for support staff to ensure proper maintenance of Linux systems. • Serve as the escalation point for 24x7 support. • Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications: Education: • Bachelor’s degree in related field is preferable. • Red Hat Certified or Red Hat Certified Systems Administrator preferred Experience: • A minimum of Five years’ experience with Red Hat Enterprise Linux is required • A minimum of Five years’ experience with VM Ware and it’s derivatives (VSAN, NSX, VRealize) • Experience with the design, planning, implementation, and maintenance of Red Hat Enterprise / Cent Os Linux Servers is required. • Experience with Apache, Tomcat, MySQL, Perl Scripting, Required. • Experience with Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery are required. • Experience with clustering is required. • Experience with Hana and Oracle are preferred. • Experience with CentOS is a plus. Knowledge: • Knowledge of commonly used concepts, practices, and procedures as they relate to building high performance business-critical enterprise systems • Working knowledge of security best practices Skills: • Excellent troubleshooting and technical documentation skills • Red Hat Linux subject matter expert Abilities: • Ability to work independently and exercise judgment in decision making • Ability to collaborate with other IT Professionals to achieve common project goals • Able to work on multiple projects/priorities in a deadline-driven environment • Must be able to remain calm in pressure situations and adapt quickly to change • Able and willing to travel occasionallyRandstad Canada souscrit à la diversité et à l'équité en matière d'emploi et favorise un environnement inclusif et accessible dans lequel les clients et les employés se sentent respectés et supportés.  Nous nous engageons à construire une force de travail qui réflète la diversité de nos clients et des communautés dans lesquelles nous vivons et nous oeuvrons; et nous créons un environnement propice à ce que chaque employé ait l'opportunité d'atteindre son plein potentiel.  Randstad accueille favorablement les demandes d'emploi des femmes, des peuples autochtones, des minorités ethniques, des personnes handicapées,  des minorités visibles, et d'autres personnes qui pourraient contribuer à une plus grande diversité.Dans le cadre de notre  engagement à l'accessibilité des personnes ayant un handicap, Randstad Canada, sur demande du candidat, fournira un accommodement pendant le processus de recrutement pour assurer l'égalité d'accès à tous les candidats.  Veuillez svp contacter votre consultant ou recruteur concernant vos besoins et nous vous consulterons afin de nous assurer qu'un accommodement raisonnable adapté à vos besoins vous soit fourni.Nous encourageons tous les candidats qualifiés à postuler; veuillez noter que conformément aux exigences de l'immigration canadienne, la priorité sera toutefois accordée aux Canadiens ainsi qu'aux résidents permanents.Veuillez svp communiquer avec votre succursale locale pour tout commentaire sur l’équité ainsi que pour tout besoin d’accommodement.

description:

This is a 12 month, contract position scheduled to start in June 2017 (start date is flexible) with a strong possibility of extension.Responsibilities:Answer user inquiries regarding computer software or hardware operation to resolve problems, typically of a lower complexity;May install software or perform hardware testing remotely;Enter commands and observe system functioning to verify correct operations and detect errors;Maintain records of daily data communication transactions, problems and remedial actions taken, or installation activities;Read technical manuals, confer with users, or conduct computer diagnostics to investigate and resolve problems or to provide technical assistance and support.Required skills: Minimum 5 years of experience is required;Knowledge of computer software, such as configuration management software, desktop communications software, operating system software and internet directory services software;Full fluency in English and French;Familiarity with Service Now and Citrix (nice to have).

title: Sr Product Manager
description:
DESCRIPTIONJob location: 510 W Georgia Street, 14th Floor, Vancouver, BC, V6B 0M3Do  you want to build systems that drive key decisions for the world's  biggest e-commerce business? Do you want to pave the future of Amazon,  enhancing how we do business and grow as a key player in the global  e-commerce?Did you answer yes to the above questions? Are you ready for a unique challenge? Then this is the job for you!Our  ideal candidate can form insights and find innovative ways to act on  these insights, translate ideas into product designs, and harness the  passion and energy of teams across the company to bring these designs  into the world for our customers. We are looking for a proven candidate  who can help shape the vision and roadmap, define the principles and  framework that allows many teams to innovate quickly, and integrate  these efforts into a coherent whole.Responsibilities include  collection of business and systems requirements from internal and  external customers, writing specifications, driving project schedules  from design to release, and managing the production launch. You will  lead and coordinate design/implementation efforts between internal teams  and outside merchants and vendors to develop optimal solutions. You  will be expected to make appropriate tradeoffs to optimize  time-to-market, clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and  desired outcomes to internal cross-functional and remote project teams.Key objectives for this role include:1. Start with the customer and work backwards to define your product vision and customer needs.2. Innovate and develop friction-free products that solve problems for Amazon customers3. Manage a strong cross functional team to see their business initiatives from conception through launch.4.  Be the end-to-end owner of the product – manage the business case,  identify the Amazon value proposition, define the customer experience,  build out the product requirements, launch plan and see the business  through launch and customer adoption5. Draft strategy and product updates for the Amazon’s senior leadership teamSalary Range: $97,200 to $162,300/yr, commensurate with experienceBenefits:  Amazon provides a full range of benefits for our global employees and  their eligible family members. Eligible employees may also receive  signing bonuses and Amazon Restricted Stock Units. While they might vary  from location to location, Amazon benefits for Canada may include:· Health Care· Savings Plans· Income Protection· Paid Time Off· Signing Bonuses· Employee StockBASIC QUALIFICATIONS·  BS in Computer Science or an engineering field and an MBA. 5-8 years  product management experience, preferably in delivering customer-facing  products/service· Experience managing product, project, or program teams· Minimum of 5 years of software development, testing, and technology or product management experience with internet businesses·  Minimum of 2 years of experience translating customer needs into  product features, user interface design, and pricing models to deliver  an unparalleled customer experience· Market and customer analysis skills with demonstrated willingness and capability to learn new areas quickly·  Demonstrated ability to define requirements, specifications, and  metrics for successful web services and/or customer experiences  efficiently and with quality.· Demonstrated ability to formulate  data-driven decisions that lead to results. Experience using data and  metrics to back up assumptions and assertions of business value· Demonstrated ability to conceptualize, manage, and prioritize multiple projects.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSAll applicants must meet the qualifications above.Contact information: To apply, please visit

title: Technical Team Lead
description:
Technical Team Lead | Monster.com


















































 Technical Team Lead at CGI Info Systems Mgmt Cons Inc.
 
Halifax, NS













About the Job

 Technical Team Lead Position Description Looking for an opportunity to build a team in the banking sector?  We are looking for a Technical Team Lead to provide leadership and mentorship in support of a team for a large banking client in the Regulatory and Compliance space.  The client is looking to begin leveraging DevOps in this area, so if you have the initiative to learn about these systems, we can provide the opportunity to put your knowledge into practice.  Persons should have a high degree of consulting ability and business acumen, and be able to lead a team of people to support the client's applications.  The client has a number of applications involving several technologies, so this role will appeal to systems analysts who want to broaden their experience in preparation for future roles as either a delivery manager or a solution architect.  Knowledge of either Java or .Net is required, and experience with SQL, ETL technologies, and Tibco AMS would be helpful, since you will be providing direction to team members working with those technologies.  Someone who has a high degree of initiative, can lead a team to provide application support and development, and with the desire to work on a strategic engagement that is looking to grow our business with the client will find this opportunity appealing.  We offer the opportunity to work with Canada’s largest Information Technology Outsourcing and Management Consulting Company, who have been rated as one of the top employers in Canada.  CGI is a true global presence in a fast-paced and energetic atmosphere where your personal and professional growth is accelerated by your desire and sense of commitment. CGI’s continuous growth is a testament to the confidence clients place in them and to the dedication of their professionals. At CGI, all employees are called members because they feel a powerful sense of ownership and accountability. Your future duties and responsibilities Accountable for the analysis and resolution of incidents related to banking compliance applications, as well as analysis, design, and development of enhancements to these applications delivered into the client’s environments.  This includes researching, designing, troubleshooting, writing documentation, coding, debugging, and conducting code reviews throughout the solution’s lifecycle.  This includes translation of requirements into design artifacts, writing and unit testing software, incident and problem management,  leading developer teams to product high quality software, and providing support to the client's technical staff. Required qualifications to be successful in this role Must Have Technical Skills10 years experience in IT•Requirements Analysis and verification•Excellent communication skills•Excellent consulting skills•Experience with either Java or .Net•Minimum 2-year post-secondary education in IT or related disciple.•Exposure to JIRA or other bug reporting tool•Ability to learn and use new software applications quickly and easily•Systems Analysis •Attention to detail•Excellent technical documentation skills•Strong analytical skills; ability to root cause issues•Knowledge of Software Development principlesNice to have Skills•Knowledge of the banking domain•Knowledge to ETL/database•Knowledge of BPM systemsSoft Skills•Strong interpersonal skills•Strong written and oral and comprehension communication skills •Positive attitude •Flexibility, self-motivated, and has the ability to give and receive feedback •Ability to working effectively and collaboratively with others to achieve common goals•Able to multitask effectively•Have excellent time management, task planning and prioritization skills•Able to adapt quickly to changing client requirements•Able to work effectively with minimal supervision•Enjoy working in a self-teaching, learning organization•Ability to build strong relationships with clients and team member  At CGI, we’re a team of builders. We call our employees members because all who join CGI are building their own company - one that has grown to 68,000 professionals located in 40 countries. Founded in 1976, CGI is a leading IT and business process services firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients - and for our members. Come grow with us. Learn more at  This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit participation and stock purchase plans.We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No unsolicited agency referrals please.CGI is an equal opportunity employer. title: MANAGER / DIRECTOR, IT (SOLUTIONS ARCHITECTURE)
description:
POSITION TITLE: MANAGER / DIRECTOR, IT (SOLUTIONS ARCHITECTURE)JOB CATEGORY:Information Technology/Software EngineeringINDUSTRY: Power DistributionLOCATION: LONDON, ONDATE: May 19, 2017JOB ORDER NUMBER: 200400THE COMPANY: Our client is a major regional utility servicing commercial, industrial and residential customers in southwestern Ontario.  Unlike the perception of many utility operations they are very much avant-garde in their operations and culture, and their expertise and tools are sought after by many similar companies. THE OPPORTUNITY: They are currently seeking the talents of an experienced IT Manager/ Director to shoulder the responsibilities of the Systems Architecture department of their IT team.POSITION DESCRIPTION:  The successful applicant will be responsible to:-Lead the strategic design/roadmap, acquisition, management, and implementation of the IT infrastructure.-Provide leadership in enterprise and emerging systems such as SAP.-Provide recommendations impacting the selection and use of information technology.-Develop, articulate and evolve the corporation's strategic information technology structural direction.-Evaluate and analyze solutions from such perspectives as architecture, feasibility and cost.-Lead multidisciplinary teams responsible for improving or re-engineering business processes and information systems.-Manage long-term strategic planning, documentation and training.-Coordinate the creation of policies, standards and guidelines regarding the selection, development, implementation and use of information technology platform.EXPERIENCE: In order to be COMPETITIVE for this position, you will have:-8 to 15 years experience in increasingly senior roles in a corporate IT setting.-At least 5 years’ experience managing a team of 8 or more IT staff.-Several years’ experience in an SAP environment.-Several years’ experience focusing on System Architecture.-Knowledge of specialized architecture in areas such as cloud computing, networks, cyber security and emerging technologies (e.g. SaaS, Green Button, Bluemix-Watson).NOTE:  Applications that do not meet the above requirements will not be acknowledged.COMPENSATION: $100,000 - $120,000EDUCATION: Degree in Computer SystemsEMPLOYMENT TYPE: Permanent, Full-TimeREQUIRED TRAVEL: NoneRELOCATION ASSISTANCE: NoMANAGES OTHERS: Yes - 10CONTACT: Reg Shortt,  P.Eng., CPCHOW TO APPLY:Please click on the “APPLY” button located elsewhere on this job posting (preferred) or email your resume along with your answers to the following questions to: LEARN MORE ABOUT THE RECRUITER:Reg Shortt:   QUESTIONS:How many years’ experience do you have in increasingly senior roles in a corporate IT environment?How many years’ experience do you have at the Manager or Director level?How many years’ experience do you have in a SAP environment?How many years’ experience do you have working on System Architecture issues?What is your level of knowledge of specialized architecture in EACH OF the following areas - cloud computing, networks, cyber security and emerging technologies (e.g. SaaS, Green Button, Bluemix-Watson)?What is your current or most recent salary?How much bonus or other cash incentive did you earn in the past year? ABOUT STOAKLEY-STEWART CONSULTANTS:Stoakley-Stewart Consultants Ltd. is an Executive Search/Recruiting Firm with international reach. We opened our doors in 1977 and have grown to be one of the most successful employment agencies in Canada, boasting over 300 person-years of recruiting expertise.  We house a team of top-notch consultants, each acting as Subject Matter Expert in their chosen field. As a result we provide professional recruiting services to clients and candidates in a variety of industries.This expansive breadth of experience allows us, as a firm, to satisfy all of your hiring/employment needs. In accordance with Canadian laws, it is the policy of Stoakley-Stewart Consultants to consider all qualified individuals for available positions without regard to race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, country of origin, age, disability etc.See ALL of our open jobs at: WHAT ARE WE KNOWN FOR AND HOW DO WE HELP?-Helping talented professionals secure new, exciting and rewarding career opportunities.-Treating each unique individual with professionalism, respect and integrity.-Meeting your distinct needs by matching you with the right corporate culture.YOU CAN ALSO VISIT US AT AND FOLLOW US ON:Website: LinkedIn: Twitter (@stoakleystewart): Facebook: YouTube:

title: Payment Hub Developer
description:
Payment Hub Developer | Monster.com


















































 Payment Hub Developer at CGI Info Systems Mgmt Cons Inc.
 
Toronto, ON













About the Job

 Payment Hub Developer Position Description We are Canada's largest independent information technology services firm, and after 40 years, we're still growing! Join Canada's largest IT Company in our Banking Services Vertical. Your future duties and responsibilities •	Perform analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, evaluation, and support of new and existing Payment Hub systems•	Provide consultation and support to business, operations on technology solutions to complex business issues and objectives including systems and integrated architecture•	Perform development and support primarily payment application built using Java stack that are either in place or under strategic development Required qualifications to be successful in this role •	Post-secondary education in business analysis or computer related discipline or a combination of education, training, and experience•	7+ years’ experience application development experience with full lifecycle from inception through implementation•	Object-oriented design and development utilizing Java or .NET and/or mobile technologies, i.e. Objective C technologies•	Experience with application architecture design and development; Strong technical design skills and be proficient with OO design concepts and design patterns•	Experience with development, deployment, and support of large-scale distributed applications in a mission-critical production environment  At CGI, we’re a team of builders. We call our employees members because all who join CGI are building their own company - one that has grown to 68,000 professionals located in 40 countries. Founded in 1976, CGI is a leading IT and business process services firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients - and for our members. Come grow with us. Learn more at  This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit participation and stock purchase plans.We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No unsolicited agency referrals please.CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs. Technical Solution Architect
description:
Technical Solution Architect | Monster.com


















































 Technical Solution Architect at CGI Info Systems Mgmt Cons Inc.
 
Toronto, ON













About the Job

 Technical Solution Architect Position Description We are Canada's largest independent information technology services firm, and after 40 years, we're still growing! Join Canada's largest IT Company in our Banking Services Vertical. Your future duties and responsibilities Act as liaison and bridge/facilitate the communication and understanding between the EA team and business owners •	Create and maintains enterprise payments architecture within the Enterprise context•	Provide technical leadership and consultation to development teams working on the enterprise payments modernization•	Technology lead role in vendor engagements to assess their product offerings and integrations into enterprise payments architecture•	Collaborate with other Solution Architects and provides estimation details (e.g., cost and benefits) of technology solutions to the business partner, including investment plan input •	Represent enterprise payments technology directions to other areas of T&O in order to share information •	Represent enterprise payments modernization program and/or the Enterprise at industry and external organizations to exchange information •	Represent enterprise payments program in various review and governance bodies to provide expertise with respect to technology solution •	Develop and maintains enterprise payments architecture within the Enterprise context to ensure operational maintenance •	Analyzing technology and payment industry and market trends, and determine their potential impact on enterprise payments modernization program Required qualifications to be successful in this role •	University degree and/or advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent•	8-10 years of progressive experience in designing, architecting, analyzing, supporting, and integrating enterprise infrastructure and application initiatives, solutions, and projects in a financial services and/or payments industry•	Track record of providing high level estimates and solutions architecture based on requirements•	Advanced knowledge of Enterprise Architecture frameworks, methodologies, and tools. CBAB, TOGAF, or ITIL certifications are considered assets•	Exhibits solid business knowledge, and advanced knowledge of technology industry, products, and processes, involving exposure to multiple disciplines and/or multiple industries and familiarity with the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC, e.g. Agile) including project management and requirements management methodologies  At CGI, we’re a team of builders. We call our employees members because all who join CGI are building their own company - one that has grown to 68,000 professionals located in 40 countries. Founded in 1976, CGI is a leading IT and business process services firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients - and for our members. Come grow with us. Learn more at  This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit participation and stock purchase plans.We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No unsolicited agency referrals please.CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Customer Success Lead
description:
Our client....  Dynamic very well funded start-up, disrupting a billion dollar industry and designed to ensure clients can focus their time on high value services so businesses can get back to running their companies.  Their cutting edge, cloud based technology allows them to constantly innovate through research, products, and services... Smarter.  What's in it for you?  Be part of a true start up environment where the decisions you make and the relationships you establish set the foundation for continued growth and client satisfaction for years to come. Join a growing team of professionals in a challenging work environment.    Responsibilities Own the relationship with customersWork with Product group to collect feedback and make sure it is implemented into the actual productWill manage the client support experience for strategic accountsManage and grow revenue.Oversee all customer support functions in the division, including overall client communication, identification and resolution of low-level issues, escalation of and collaboration with the development team to reach efficient resolution of complex issues.Lead and facilitate the team's proactive communication with clients to provide outstanding support, assist with custom application needs and improve overall product experience. Objectively measure and improve client satisfaction using key best practice metrics to drive decisions.Supervise and guide the daily activities of the technical support team to ensure that all tickets are completed in a timely and effective manner, consistent with corporate objectives and metrics.Constantly monitor the support ticketing and project systems, reconciling systems daily. Proactively identify support issue patterns and resolve efficiently. Develop and evaluate metrics to maximize efficiency and gauge client satisfaction.Coach and train team members to boost performance and foster each individual's personal and career development. Assist with recruiting of best-in-class team members.  Must Have: 5 or more years of experience with Customer Success for technology businessesExperience in Financial Audit Software, Audit or Financial industries, with an emphasis on Technology a plusCPA background preferredExceptional leadership qualities

title: Director of IT-Toronto based
description:
Job DescriptionLombart Instrument Company, the leading distributor of diagnostic instrumentation for eye care professionals in the United States, is seeking a dynamic and proven leader to serve as their enterprise IT Director. This senior level role will be responsible for all internal and external IT resources, and for the planning and realization of a multi-year IT strategy for Lombart Instrument (Norfolk, VA) and Innova Medical (Toronto, Canada).The IT Director will be responsible for the successful implementation of a new, ERP and CRM platform that supports consolidated financial reporting and end-to-end business processes across two companies. The ideal candidate will have strong managerial skills and attention to detail, deep hands-on ERP and infrastructure experience, and a great sense of integrated business processes, ideally in the wholesale distribution and light manufacturing industries.Company OverviewLombart is the largest independent, ophthalmic instrument distributorship to U.S.-based ophthalmologist and optometrist practices, universities, hospitals and the U.S. government. In February 2017, Lombart acquired Innova Medical Ophthalmics, the largest independent Canadian, value-added distributor of ophthalmic equipment, products and services to the eye care industry.Lombart Instrument Company offers a competitive base salary along with an attractive incentive compensation structure. Benefits include Medical/Dental coverage availability, 401K plan, and coverage for appropriate business expenses.Key ResponsibilitiesManage all aspects of IT and the delivery of high quality information technologies that drive process efficiencies, data integrity, reporting accuracy, and information security.Manage the Microsoft Dynamics NAV ERP and CRM implementation project and ensure the system supports business requirements and establishes a platform that drives future growth.Successfully balance the need for process discipline rigor while maintaining innovation and speed of development.Translate business needs into IT investment priorities and manage the ongoing project roadmap as the business and systems continue to mature.Operate with a sense of urgency to identify salient issues and remove roadblocks while maintaining the integrity of the project deliverables and timeline.Develop system and organizational roadmaps that ensure business and service continuity.Ensure data center, network, desktop, security, and other infrastructure meet the needs of the business.Develop Business Analytics using ERP, OLAP and other data sources in a modern reporting tool that drive meaningful insights and decisions at all levels of the Company.Ensure there is high quality master data, transactional integrity, and integration between operations, sales, service management, and finance.Develop IT software development methodology and governance procedures to ensure high levels of user adoption, system performance, data access and security.Ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements.Develop and manage overall IT budget planning and adherence and reports to the CFO.Key Selection CriteriaA Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, ideally from a top school.At least seven years of IT experience in leadership roles at mid-sized, multi-site wholesale distribution, CPG and/or manufacturing companies. Medical instrument experience desirable.At least two ERP implementations in a lead role, ideally with Microsoft Dynamics technology, managing both internal and external resourcesAt least five years of hands-on ERP experience, developing and configuring solutions in dynamic companies, ideally using Microsoft Dynamics.Strong knowledge of operational, financial, and sales business processes and ERP/CRM system integration.Strong knowledge of all components of a Microsoft centric infrastructure landscape, including database, OS and desktop productivity technologies.Experience designing and managing Business Analytics and reporting solutions that take advantage of data cube, OLAP, visualization technologies.Experience with an outsourced IT service provider (e.g. SaaS, Hosting provider, Application Services), including negotiating and managing complex IT services contracts.Consulting Experience is a strong plus.Experience implementing and managing CRM solutions is a plus.Excellent grasp of IT governance, change management, and development Agile and SDLC methodologies.Strategically driven goal-oriented planner with the ability to develop objectives with action steps, and implement and execute a strategic plan.Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills (all forms) at all levels of the organization.Ability to prioritize time and delegate as appropriate to effectively handle a diversity of time sensitive and often high pressure tasks.Ability to travel up to 50% of the time.


About Lombart Instrument:
Founded in 1979, Lombart is the largest independent, value-added distributor of ophthalmic instruments to ophthalmologist and optometrist practices in the U.S.  It has been the #1 player in the segment since 1987 and has the strongest brand recognition amongst its peers.  The Company sells the broadest range of products from top suppliers which allows Lombart to outfit an exam room under any budget.

title: Service Desk Technician - Washington Companies
description:
Headquartered in Missoula, Montana, Washington Corporations leads development of efficient, best practice solutions for the commons business needs of the Washington Companies, a vibrant group of individual and independently operated entities. Each company displays a unique entrepreneurial spirit that is individually cultured and managed by professional teams, guided by separate Boards of Directors.Moving Industries AheadThe Washington Companies have grown and diversified by focusing on core industries in six primary sectors: rail transportation, marine transportation, construction and mining, heavy equipment sales, aviation technology and real estate development. Our purpose is to reliably provide equipment, technology, service and special expertise that aid our customers in operating more efficiently and profitably.  Our companies are headquartered throughout the United States and Western Canada and conduct business internationally.The Service Desk Technician will be based in the Seaspan Head Office in North Vancouver, BC. As a Service Desk Technician, your primary responsibility will be to ensure proper computer operation so that end users can accomplish business tasks. This includes receiving, prioritizing, documenting and actively resolving end user help requests and escalating incidents when considered appropriate and necessary to maintain service level agreement expectations. Problem resolution may involve the use of diagnostic and help request tracking tools, as well as require that the individual give in-person, hands-on help at the desktop level.Your future career opportunity As a Service Desk Technician, your primary responsibility will be to ensure proper computer operation so that end users can accomplish business tasks. This includes receiving, prioritizing, documenting and actively resolving end user help requests and escalating incidents when considered appropriate and necessary to maintain service level agreement expectations. Problem resolution may involve the use of diagnostic and help request tracking tools, as well as require that the individual give in-person, hands-on help at the desktop level.Duties/AccountabilitiesResponsibilities and Technical Skills Required:Field help desk calls and coordinate problem resolution Learn and become proficient with core technologies Experience and understanding of IT Service Management Support other IT project leads and team members in the support, testing and training of the user base on business applications. Assist in software releases and roll-outs and communication to the end users.  Perform preventative maintenance, including checking and cleaning of workstations, printers, and peripherals. Evaluate documented resolutions and help contribute to the resolutions library.  Develop help sheets and FAQ lists for end users. Analyze trends for ways to prevent future problems and alert management to emerging trends in incidents. Field incoming requests to the Service Desk to ensure courteous, timely and effective resolution of end user issues.Business Skills Required:Business Knowledge: The individual should have a working knowledge of all electronic devices.  Ability to be resourceful and innovative to quickly and creatively adapt to the changing landscape in Information Technology. Executes/Results-Driven: Sets and conveys clear goals and monitors progress; is accessible and supports other team members; obtains results and adds value to the organization by making timely and sound decisions and influencing others. Attention to Detail: A concern for ensuring accuracy, clarity and quality of work reflecting an underlying drive to increase efficiency and track organizational measures. Collaboration and Teamwork: Creates commitment to common goals; identifies competing interests and finds ways to balance them; values contributions of all team members and other constituencies; values team accomplishments over individual accomplishments; leverages others' strengths and experiences to achieve team goals; co-operates with colleagues and shares resources. Client/Relationship Management: Establishes and builds relationships with clients. Applies knowledge to the business and provides personalized, value-added service. Demonstrates willingness to meet needs of clients by pursuing improved courses of action; delivers products and services that best serve client needs; uses client feedback as a basis for improving service and performs necessary follow-up work without being prompted. Required Education and ExperienceAssociate's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, or equivalent experience is preferred. Four years’ experience in customer service is required. Experience in a technical support role is preferred. Experience with IT Service Management practices – ServiceNow experience preferred Knowledge of common best practice financial, accounting, and business practices. Strong knowledge of system testing best practices and methodologies. Direct hands-on experience with ad hoc query programs, automated testing tools, and reporting software. Exceptional oral and written communication Good phone etiquette and the ability to diffuse agitated situations. Expertise in Microsoft Office, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint Basic hardware troubleshooting skillsSkills and Knowledge and Required CompetenciesExcellent customer service attitude Ability to collaborate with a variety of personalities and skillsets, and improve the quality of IT processes, services and products Excellent organizational abilities and customer service skills. Ability to operate effectively and professionally under pressure Self-motivated with a strong aptitude and desire to learn Strong organizational and interpersonal skills Desktop/laptop/network troubleshooting skills. Successfully perform job duties in accordance with defined procedures and with limited supervisionPlease note that this position requires extensive travel to and from Montana, USA. Move your career forward and join an established industry leader with a long-standing history of success.On offer to youSeaspan can provide you with a rewarding and challenging career building state-of-the-art ships, and an attractive remuneration package with pension contributions, medical and dental benefits and a fitness membership for all permanent employees. A relocation package and work permit sponsorship (if required) will be offered to candidates to ensure a smooth transition to Vancouver, a city that has consistently been rated amongst the top 3 most livable cities in the world.Seaspan is a progressive employer with a collaborative culture that supports health, safety and diversity. Seaspan encourages applications from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, aboriginal persons and persons with disabilities. Note: Unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted.












Seaspan is an association of Canadian companies primarily involved in coastal marine transportation, shipdocking/ship escort, ship repair and shipbuilding services in Western North America. In addition to the marine transportation services offered directly through Seaspan, commercial ferry, shipyard and bunkering services are provided via affiliate companies: Marine Petrobulk, Seaspan Ferries, Vancouver Drydock, Vancouver Shipyards and Victoria Shipyards.

title: Data Architect
description:
MatchBox Consulting Group Job Application for Data Architect | Monster.com


















































 Data Architect at MatchBox Consulting Group
 
Burnaby, BC













About the Job

MatchBox Consulting Group is currently searching for a Data Architect to work with the business to understand data related needs and how existing data assets can meet those needs or be extended to meet those needs.  This is a full-time permanent position.Responsibilities:-Works with management to establish long-term domain architecture and corporate data model strategies.-Works with Software Architects to ensure that the data architectures match the software architectures. -Creates and maintains the corporate data models and ensures that they concur with the production and development object models and schemas.-Creates and maintains the corporate business intelligence data models and ensures that they concur with the corporate data models and schemas.-Works with business users to define requirements, performs business analysis and design, and implements robust, maintainable solutions that meet the business requirements. -Keeps abreast with standards and trends with respect to software architectures, data architectures, and design and development concepts. -Assesses data related technologies, and provides feedback to management as to their quality and appropriateness with respect to the enterprise environment.-Establishes, maintains and communicates standards, guidelines, and data architecture best practices. -Creates and communicates technology white papers relevant to the enterprises technology and software and data development initiatives.-Mentors, provides strong methodology leadership, and works closely with development and implementation teams; and for each phase of a project, works with the project management to identify and mitigate data architecture risks. -Through reviews and quality assurance processes ensures that the data architectures and standards are being adhered to. -Evaluates the impact and appropriateness, from a software and data architecture standpoint, of changes to the environment, by reviewing and recommending any appropriate remediation for change control requests and notifications.-Evaluates appropriateness, from a data architecture standpoint, of disaster recovery and business continuityplans for all application platforms, and assists with remediation of the same.Requirements:-A level of knowledge equivalent to a Technical Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree, plus specialized computer training courses relating to software development and data modeling. -Substantial experience in data modeling (specifically relational), object models, and business intelligence models.-Strong proficiency in communicating with business users and translating their data needs into solutions.-Proficiency in these technologies and tools are required:-Enterprise Data Design Patterns for OLTP o Data Warehouse Designs for OLAP o Sybase PowerDesigner or ERWin o SQL o T-SQL o Microsoft SQLServer -Extensive experience in all levels of data modeling (including conceptual, logical and physical) including experience in software analysis, design and development.-Above average communication skills and the ability to interact with senior management and all levels of the business user community.-Experience in proactive roles in Data Governance initiatives.Headquartered in downtown Vancouver and serving clients nationally, MatchBox is a recruitment and solutions firm that specializes in the fields of IT & Technology, Engineering & Technical and Accounting & Finance.We offer unrivaled expertise with a team that has many years of experience in the recruitment and professional services industry. Our recruitment consultants work in specific vertical markets and our passion is building great connections, creating strong opportunities, and delivering that perfect match.Please visit our website at

description:
Container Developer - Permanent – 8332 | Monster.com















































 Container Developer - Permanent – 8332 at LRO Staffing
 
Ottawa, ON













About the Job

Container Developer - Permanent – 8332 About the Opportunity We are currently recruiting for Container/Microservices Developer for our client located in the west end.  This is a permanent position with a well established Ottawa based organization with a very cool product.  Our client continues to grow and is a leader in their industry.   About You The ideal candidate will have experience delivering solutions in the containerized development space.  Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, and working with Microservices design methodology is required.  You must have the ability and experience to deliver quality software on a consistent basis.  Finally, the ideal candidate will have a degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) and possess exceptional communication and presentation skills.  Salary Range Our client is offering a competitive compensation package which will include a base salary, bonus, generous vacation allotment, and a comprehensive benefits package.  How to Apply Please apply by clicking the “Apply” button and follow the link to submit your résumé. You can also apply by submitting your résumé directly to . One of our Recruiters will be in touch with you if your profile meets the requirements for the role and the expectations of our clients. Please note that all candidates must be permitted to work in Canada to be considered for this opportunity.    About Us With deep expertise in specialized recruitment and staffing, LRO Staffing places qualified professionals in contract, permanent and temporary roles. LRO Staffing's singular focus on finding the right fit for companies and candidates has helped organizations and individuals succeed for more than 10 years.  We specialize in placing candidates and contractors in Accounting, Finance, Technology, Law, Government Services, Human Resources, Communications, Construction and Executive Support roles.     Better jobs. Better people. Better fit.

title: UI/UX Lead
description:
UI/UX Lead | Monster.com


















































 UI/UX Lead at CGI Info Systems Mgmt Cons Inc.
 
Toronto, ON













About the Job

 UI/UX Lead Position Description CGI is looking for a profoundly engaged experience design leader to join us. In this role, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team of designers, planners and researchers committed to designing the future of banking. The Lead UX / UI Designer will help set the direction, vision, and methodology for a growing team. This will require a strong point of view on design, hands-on creation of experiences, developing strategies for implementation within a complex ecosystem and building meaningful relationships within the organization. Your future duties and responsibilities •	Create and deliver various designs for mobile, web, and print mediums•	Utilize UX research strategies and frameworks to make decisions about design (Information Architecture, Wireframing, User Testing, etc.)•	Collaborate with the development team to deliver clear and design specifications•	Take a leadership role within the team overseeing and managing the development of the mobile app•	Create user-centered designs by considering market analysis, customer feedback, and usability findings•	Recognize and predict use cases and user interaction, and design intuitive applications to support them.•	Stay abreast of UX trends, as well as corporate and industry standards looking for creative ideas Required qualifications to be successful in this role •	Bachelor’s degree in graphic design, marketing, computer science, or other related fields•	4+ years of UI / UX, graphic, and visual design in a corporate or agency context•	Experience and a demonstrated knowledge of designing for iOS and Android mobile app interfaces•	Able to take feedback constructively and iterate on designs and ideas from multiple stakeholders with differing opinions•	Creative thinker who likes to get their hands dirty, can effectively innovate big ideas and also execute on the details•	A passion for good design and innovation•	Experience with an agile development process•	Experience with wireframing, prototyping, and specification delivery tools and process•	Portfolio showing your UI and UX skills is required  At CGI, we’re a team of builders. We call our employees members because all who join CGI are building their own company - one that has grown to 68,000 professionals located in 40 countries. Founded in 1976, CGI is a leading IT and business process services firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the global resources, expertise, stability and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients - and for our members. Come grow with us. Learn more at  This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development. Benefits for full-time, permanent members start on the first day of employment and include a paid time-off program and profit participation and stock purchase plans.We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. No unsolicited agency referrals please.CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
