Work Place Manager
description:
At HeyOrca, we are building a sandbox for marketing agencies to get content reviewed and approved by their clients. We believe that the best agencies involve their clients at critical stages of the content creation process. HeyOrca exists to help these agencies by providing the best agency-client collaboration experience.A little bit about the teamWe're a team of 24 from 7 different countries based in the oldest city in North America - St. John’s, Newfoundland.We place great trust in each other to make the best decisions for the company.You will be at the organizational heart of the Pod. A Jack of All Trades, comfortable with making sense of chaos and implementing process runs efficiently. Responsibilities

Office and Inventory Management:Inventory management of office supplies is one of the key tasks. Ensure that Orcas have the tools to do their work.Making sure that office setup and decor enables productivity and reflect the culture and values of the company.Purchases and Accounting:Interacting with accountants for paying providers’ bills and issuing their company’s invoices.Manage all expenses related to the officeHR Management:Manage the downstream side of Human resources: manage contracts, gather legal documents and forward employees’ information to their accounting service (days off, sick leave etc).Team happiness and productivity:Tasks include: managing meeting rooms, providing healthy snacks at work, Managing Trip bookings, enabling access to sports activities, handling interior design, organizing internal events.Culture Guru:Documenting interesting happenings within HeyOrca. Showcasing our culture to the community. Organizing events that promote thought leadership and positioning HeyOrca as a key player in the startup ecosystem.

Organizational Skills

title: Back End Developer
description:
What is HeyOrca?As a developer, you have probably worked on some contracts and projects at some point in your life: setting up a website, developing software, consulting, ... . The success of the project relies on effective communication between you, your team and the stakeholders of the project by defining goals, deliverables, collaborating on work and communicating the results. Marketing agencies work similarly: they help tens and hundreds of clients with their marketing strategy and content; all with different expectations, deadlines and deliverables. HeyOrca is a web based tool to make sense of this chaos: bringing the marketing team and their clients together in one place to communicate, create and deliver. Think of it like github for marketing agencies. The core teamWe are shifting towards a thin server architecture which requires a lot of work to create numerous new API end-points. We also have a long list of feature requests and feedback from loving customers and our own ambitions for HeyOrca. This is where you come in:We are looking for capable back-end developers like you to join and help us deliver robust software to great customers. As our team grows and we split the technical team, we also have room for those who see themselves building and leading a back-end or integrations team within HeyOrca. Responsibilities

You are mainly responsible for expanding and maintaining the back-end of the web application and its supporting services:Working based on Scrum as part of the technical team,Working with front-end developers and the technical team to create new end-points for new features and refactoring existing onesCommunicating with the customer support team to identify and resolve bugsExpanding our internal tools. E.g. integrations with CRM, product management tools, product health monitoring, Creating automated testsExperimenting with new 3rd party APIs and replacing old onesDecoupling segments of code into separate services We are rapidly expanding our team, so we are also looking for individuals who might be interested in moving into a technical lead position towards the end of 2017. Responsibilities include:Managing the team, sprints and becoming the Scrum master of their teamHelping with hiring more back-end developer(s)Onboarding new team membersHelping the product team in defining the roadmap by providing technical insightWorking with the customer support team to maintain the quality of deliverablesProviding technical direction to the team
Qualifications

As a qualified applicant, youHave work experience with creating and maintaining a real web application.Have a computer science degree or similar education or work experience.Live in Newfoundland or are open to moving to St. John's, NL.Love web development.We believe that good programmers can pick up new languages and frameworks fairly easily, so we are not concerned about the specific language/framework you have experience in. But, we do expect applicants to be highly skilled with at least one language and framework.
Core Skills

REST
MVC
Laravel
PHP
Web Development
Backend Development
Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Agile Methodologies

Additional Information

Before we tell you about HeyOrca, read what others think of us:  HeyOrca was founded in January 2015, has passed two rounds of investment by some of the best venture capital funds in Atlantic Canada and now consists of 26 brilliant minds. We mostly work from our new office location in St. John’s with an open office concept where you can literally turn your head to listen to sales calls, ask our designer for feedback or get some help with your code. That doesn’t mean we don’t know how to focus: feel free to put on your headphones or go to one of the quiet office rooms to work.We believe that HeyOrca is the right place for you, if:You want to make an impact in the early to mid stages of a successful tech company,You value learning and experimenting new ways of doing things,You are eager to take new responsibilities and face new challenges,You enjoy doing all the above all day every day.At the end of the day, a company is only the sum of its people and we genuinely can’t say enough of this team. We want amazing people like you to be part of this, grow with us and have a fulfilling career.PS. We actually have many more positions open, so  and spread the word if you like what we do.

title: Business Development Specialist

title: Overhead Crane Service Technician - Industrial Electrician - 72401
description:
Job DescriptionPerform maintenance inspections on electric overhead traveling cranes at customer locations.Conduct extensive on site electrical, electronic and mechanical troubleshooting to determine cause for equipment malfunction and establish the necessary repairs utilizing visual inspection, test procedures and appropriate test equipment.Perform on site repairs on overhead traveling cranes in conjunction with planned repairs as part of customer's maintenance contract, in response to a service call or on an emergency call due to an equipment breakdown.Responsible for a basic understanding and working knowledge or all CSA, OSHA, ANSI, CMAA, and other codes or regulations pertaining to our industry. Must be able to get specific regulations if requested.Responsible for completing all daily paperwork required accurately and completely.Document and log any quotations you provide customers (either verbal or written) and generate a document or copy of your quote for use as a follow-up sheet.Review with the customer all repairs you performed and get their signature on the daily service report indicating their acceptance of proper and completed work.Responsible for maintaining a professional appearance and image at all times.Maintain all company equipment and assets in proper working order and neat or clean.Maintain a stock of the appropriate forms and literature on the service vehicle and be capable of utilizing the proper documentation and forms used by the service department.Responsible for keeping a proper stock level of inventory and line stock items on the service vehicle.Accountable for all the company issued tools and inventory levels assigned to you.Responsible for generating sales and service leads during service calls and identifying the proper Konecranes Canada Inc. personnel of the customer's need and level of interest.Must develop a thorough working knowledge of our service literature, service policies and labour rates.Must provide customers with a "Safety Summary" on any safety items noticed during service visits and bring back a signed copy of the document as evidence of our notice to the customer. (This is a basic professional courtesy required at all times. It also may protect Konecranes Canada Inc. from any liability if the crane is used.)Must maintain regular communication with the local office and/or call in a minimum of once per day to the service branch.Responsible for understanding the procurement of basic parts on service jobs, completing the proper purchase orders and developing a good working knowledge of local vendors and vendor stocked parts. If the job permits or the situation warrants, all the ordering of parts for jobs should be done by the technician servicing the account and this time should be billed to the project.Responsible for working a "fair share" of any 24-hour calls and overtime necessary. This will be divided as equally as possible by the service supervisor/planner.Responsible for completing a "Safety Audit" on the limit switches and proper general operation of any crane you have worked on or inspected prior to leaving the customer's premises.Requirements:Minimum one (1) years' experience involving electrical and electronic troubleshooting and repair.Prefer two year associate degree in Industrial Electricity, Electronic Engineering Technology or related field or equivalent vocational/technical training and experience.Must have good mechanical aptitude, good driving record and cannot be afraid of heights.At least one year of experience of electrical/mechanical troubleshooting and repairPrior experience on cranes a plus.Physical demands:Must be able work off step ladders, climb fixed or step ladders, work from various type lifts, wear full body harness fall protection equipment and use properly, wear canister type mask and/or self contained breathing apparatus when required as personal protective equipment (PPE). Frequent lifting of parts and/or components weighing 10- 20 pounds and occasional lifting of parts and/or components weighing 30-50 pounds. Infrequent lifting of parts and/or components weighing over 50 pounds. Must be able to stand, walk and climb for extended periods.Konecranes is a global leader in the manufacturing and service of industrial overhead cranes and lifting equipment. For over 80 years, we've been dedicated to improving safety and productivity of businesses in all types of industries, including manufacturing and process industries, nuclear and renewable energy, shipyards, ports and terminals. Our strength comes from our continuous commitment to provide equipment and service that people can trust, accompanied by innovative technologies designed to improve performance, reliability and safety in every part of business operations that involve heavy lifting. We look to hire customer-oriented people who thrive on learning and problem solving in a fast paced environment. In return, we offer a good salary with highly competitive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, a Group RRSP plan with a generous company match, tuition reimbursement, life & disability insurance, vacation and other leave programs and opportunities for both formal and on the job training.Our People and CommitmentOur people are not only committed to helping our customers lift their businesses, but each other as well. Establishing meaningful relationships and collaborating with each other, with customers, and with our distributors, empowers our employees to achieve success. The passion our employees have to make a difference and enhance the quality of the lives of those around them is what makes our people unique.Share Your Knowledge and ExperienceFrom electricians to machinists to mechanics to facilities maintenance, we're looking for skilled tradespeople to collaborate with our customers. We rely on their judgment and know-how to keep our customers' manufacturing lines running smoothly to reduce downtime and improve productivity and safety.We Value Your Special Set of SkillsIf you have experience working as an industrial maintenance mechanic or electrician or experience troubleshooting three phase electrical equipment, motors and control centers, and VFDs, you can rise to the top at Konecranes. We value your know-how and your ideas. If you have a trade, we need your special set of skills to help keep our customers' equipment running.To apply, please visit our career site athttp://www.konecranes.com/career/job-openings-usa-canadaOur organization will, on request, provide accommodations for disabilities to support your participation in all aspects of our Recruitment Process.Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled





About Konecranes:
Leading the global overhead crane industry with the largest service network and a complete range of lifting equipment.

title: Manager, Tech
description:
GALE is a business agency headquartered in New York with offices in Toronto and Bangalore. We’re passionate about delivering data-driven actionable insights, game changing creative, and top-tier technology to fuel great experiences. Our team is connected by a set of core values that are important to us, and should be important to you. We’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a belief that our people should be treated like individuals, not resources.We have killer office locations in New York, Toronto, and Bangalore. We offer an emphasis on growth and professional development, good benefits, and a flexible and fun working environment. We’re looking for great people to join our team!We’re looking for a Manager, Technology to join our rapidly growing development team in Toronto. They will be enthusiastic, creative and results obsessed to design, build and deliver on complex technology solutions. Finally, they will be equally passionate about mentoring and growing a technology team of budding Full Stack Developers and Architects.The ideal candidate will have a background in enterprise architecture, specifically web based systems, with considerable exposure to open source technologies.What you will be doing: Utilize OO design principles in creating complex custom software solutions or recommending & modifying package solutions Understands and translates the impact of design on scalability, performance, security, etc. Translate the clients’ business requirements into a technology solution; has the technology breadth to offer alternative design solutions Lead other architects in designing and developing full-stack web applications using the latest web technologies like Django, React, Redux etc. Mentor a team of full stack developers and architects by helping them think through the design and development phases of a project Actively provide direction to teams by doing the following: Execute in a test driven development environment, writing unit tests and      building code to pass unit tests Execute in an agile environment using industry standard tools and   delivering weekly code releases  Establish development best practices on projects, educate and ensure the team follows these process Estimate and review other people’s estimates; proactively identify & estimate technology risk on a project Be hands on by picking up new technologies and leading the build out of a POC or a reference architecture Communicate difficult scenarios to the client and team RequirementsWho you are: Minimum 5 Years of experience in enterprise architecture, system integration, package implementation 5+ Years of experience architecting lightweight, scalable web applications Experience in Python using Flask/Django with an ORM like SQLAlchemy, Ruby on Rails Development experience in HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript Proficiency in using Bootstrap and jQuery and frameworks like Angular, Knockout, Backbone, etc. Developed databases for use with middle tier, working with MySQL, Mongo, Postgres etc. Familiar with relational or document database design Ability to adapt to the ever changing technology landscape and should be excited about constantly keeping themselves up-to-date by experimenting with new technologies and frameworks. Enthusiastic about learning and working on multiple technologies – the role requires the person to be a technology agnostic, but, still deep in at least one OO technology Proven mentoring and coaching abilities for a technical team

title: Junior or Intermediate Full Stack Software Developer
description:
Who we are looking forWe employ developers who are passionate about software development and technically excellent. Our developers work across the full stack of an application and understand that a project is not done until it has been deployed to production for our users. We want developers who can contribute positively to our culture and teach us things we didn't know before. Those same developers are always hungry to learn and improve in any way they can.Does this sound like a description of you? Read on, my friend...Things we’re looking for in terms of more specific skill-sets and experience: BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science or related technical discipline (or equivalent).Extensive programming experience in a language that demands strong OO skills (C# / Java / C++ / etc.)Experience working with javascript frameworks in a complex web applicationExperience working with other scripting languages like PHP, Ruby, Python or Perl in a web application.Coding skills in Javascript / AJAX, database design and SQL. Several years of software design and development experience, with knowledge of Unix / Linux. Ideally you’ve been coding since you were old enough to read. A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design.Previous experience with agile development methodologies and unit testing.How to ApplySend your resume to  devjobs@curvedental.com with the subject lineYour Name: Junior Full Stack Software Developer!or Your Name: Intermediate Full Stack Software Developer! as appropriate. Don’t forget to make the name substitution and to include the exclamation mark :)Don't just send us your standard cover letter; simply answer the following 3 questions:What do you know about our business and industry?Why is what we do important to our clients?What is your favourite aspect of our business, and why?This particular role is at Curve Dental's office in Calgary, Alberta, Canada.The Curve Dental StoryUnfortunately, we have only so many desks and so much capacity. Not everyone gets a chance to work at Curve. But, for the lucky few—the ones that have talent, the ones who can see beyond fossil fuels—these have the chance to work in an evolved and developer-focused culture.Our main product, Curve Hero, is a fully-featured web application that helps dental professionals manage and build a killer practice. We are the market leader, that one guy everyone wants to be. We believe in open-source and have a commitment to building quality code and awesome applications that push the envelope. If our developers are thinking outside the box, our customers are pushing the envelope in dentistry, too.Curve is growing, and stretching, and exploring, and shining a flashlight in the corners to see what’s out there, which all means we have interesting, challenging projects that are meaningful for the dental profession—projects that require the right kind of developer.Why You Want to Work HereZen Time. Quiet work environment with minimal meetings. Developers spend all but a few hours each week writing code.Me Time. Strong commitment to good work / life balance. Balanced engineers write better code.Smart Colleagues. Technically excellent team staffed by very knowledgeable and passionate developers. You can learn from great developers who are also keen to learn from you.Quality First. Commitment to building things the right way (i.e. project time dedicated to refactoring, strong unit testing culture, etc.).Immediate Gratification. Continuous Delivery means that code changes can take hours or days to hit production (rather than weeks or months)Testing. We have a QA department to make sure your code rocks as you intended it.Quality First, Again. Code reviews (that are both productive and educational) are baked into the process we use to ship code.Aerodynamic Processes. Solid product development process that is robust but doesn't get in the way of iterative development centred around minimal viable products; our process is continuously being tweaked and improved to make sure we are doing the right things at the right times.All Bases Covered. Full stack development from the database right through to the UI. Developers touch all parts of the codebase.Remote Flexibility. We do most of our work at the office (where the best collaboration happens), but we are able to work remotely, too, which makes life easier at times.Food and Beverage. We bring in lunch once a week; we keep a cooler stocked with your favourite beverages.

description:

You’ll have the ability to contribute to key architectural decisions while building awesome experiences that have a meaningful impact on our users.Instant embraces Agile and DevOps practices to deliver highly scalable, highly available, and secure software, with daily releases. We work in a collaborative environment of continuous learning - we expect you to challenge us as much as we challenge you!RequirementsYou'll need to have: 5+ years experience developing production-quality software at high scale Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience Ability to learn new technologies and paradigms rapidly Strong JavaScript skills Familiarity with non-relational databases such as MongoDB Proficiency in a Linux environment Deep knowledge of web technologies Excellent spoken and written English It'd be great if you have experience with: Test automation Working in an Agile+DevOps development environment Writing node.js microservices Writing full stack applications in a framework such as meteor Any JavaScript framework such as Angular, React, or similar BenefitsYou'll work in an innovative start up, well funded, proactive and which offers full time flexibility, right in heart of Plateau Mont Royal.

title: Senior Manager Software Development
description:
Name of employer: Amazon Canada Fulfillment Services, Inc.Address of employer:    Job duties: Would you like to be a part of a technology team that   enables some of the most profitable businesses at Amazon? Would you like   to manage engineering teams that bring new features to millions of   Amazon customers while having fun and filing new inventions along the   way? If you answered yes to both the questions, then we would like to   talk to you about the Sr. Manager, Software development position for the   Amazon Payment Products team.  We are responsible for   developing the platform and applications used to introduce new and   innovative payment methods to customers worldwide as well as support   Amazon's global Cobrand and Private Label credit cards along with the   world's largest rewards catalog, Shop with Points. The technology we   build and operate varies widely, ranging from large scale Distributed   Engineering incorporating the latest from Machine Learning in the Big   Data space to customer and mobile friendly User Experiences.   You will co-ordinate the establishment and execution of long-term   architectural roadmaps for your teams. You will drive continual   improvements to the efficiency and flexibility of the systems while   keeping a high bar for security and availability. You will work closely   with multiple engineering teams within Amazon as well as third party   financial institutions around the world to deliver your roadmap. You   will work with your engineering leaders to recruit and grow world-class   engineering talent. You will have excellent communication skills and   will partner effectively with your business teams in communicating   strategy, status and technical vision to the senior management. Salary Range: $168,500 to $281,400/yr, commensurate with experience   Benefits: Amazon provides a full range of benefits for our global   employees and their eligible family members. Eligible employees may also   receive signing bonuses and Amazon Restricted Stock Units. While they   might vary from location to location, Amazon benefits for Canada may   include:Health CareSavings PlansIncome ProtectionPaid Time OffSigning BonusesEmployee StockBasic QualificationsBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline15+ years experience planning, designing, developing and delivering software.6+   years of people management experience, leading technical professionals   including software developers, development managers, and/or technical   program managersMinimum 3+ years of managing Software Development ManagersKnowledge of Unix/Linux, C++ or Java, OO and Service Oriented Architecture.Excellent   written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present   complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety   of audiences.Preferred QualificationsAbility to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.Experience designing and developing large scale, high traffic applications.Exceptional   customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true   requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative   technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet   aggressive timelines with optimal solutionsExpertise in leading the delivery of large-scale services for complex business offerings   Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority /   Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.Please apply via:

title: ETL Developer
description:
The ETL Developer will be responsible for supporting all the data needs of various departments of our clients. The job functions include, but are not limited to developing complex MS SQL Server queries for data extraction and reporting, performing data conversions (ETL) from several data sources, developing necessary SQL for loading, and updating and maintaining data tables. Also, trouble-shooting data file related issues, and quality control. Main Responsibilities  Will be part of the BI Team and will work closely with the BI data architect and reporting team. Participate & lead Business Requirements, Solution Design and Customer workshop  Perform data analysis, dimension modeling, metrics and KPI definition Develop and maintain data standards, processes and templates as required to support data-intensive applications; Perform data modelling and provide guidance/consultation on schema designs and extensions/updates; Design and Implement Data integration, quality, profile and ETL process Aid efforts to perform Data mapping, data extraction and loading Identify and recommend opportunities to improve data quality throughout various projects Identify the business implications of data-related decisions Perform logical and/or physical modeling of data ***************************Le Développeur ETL sera responsable de soutenir tous les besoins en données des divers départements de nos clients. Les fonctions incluent, mais ne sont pas limitées, au développement de requêtes complexes MS SQL Server pour l'extraction de données et de rapport, faire la conversion de données (ETL) de plusieurs sources de données, développant le SQL nécessaire pour le chargement et la mise à jour des tables de données. Aussi, intervenir pour régler les problèmes liés aux fichiers de données pour des questions de contrôle qualité. Principales responsabilités   Faire partie de l’équipe BI et travailler étroitement avec l’architecte de données BI et les membres de l’équipe. Participer et mener à bien les exigences opérationnelles et la conception de solutions. Exécuter l’analyse des données, la modélisation de dimension, de métriques et la définition de KPI. Développer et maintenir des normes de données, des processus ainsi que des modèles exigés pour soutenir des applications avec un fort volume de données. Exécuter le modelage des données et fournir les conseils sur la conception de schémas et des mises à jour.  Concevoir et implémenter l’intégration de données, la qualité, le profil et les processus ETL. Collaborer sur la cartographie de données, leur extraction et le chargement.  Identifier et recommander les opportunités d’amélioration de la qualité des données au cours des divers projets.  Identifier l’implication de l’activité par rapport aux données liées aux décisions. Effectuer la modélisation physique/logique des données. RequirementsA successful candidate will have:  Strong knowledge of ETL tool: Microsoft Sql Server Integration Services (SSIS),  Knowledge of SAP Business Objects Data Services (BODS) and Informatica Demonstrated ability to learn new tools and technologies Knowledge of software or applications development life cycle Ability to conceptualize clients' needs and translate into specific implementation strategies Ability to work independently and as part of a team Experience and knowledge in data management, data modelization, DataMart, Data Warehouse, ETL development, MDX, OLAP *********************Le candidat idéal aura :  Solide connaissance des outils ETL : Microsoft Sql Server Integration Services (SSIS). Connaissance de SAP Business Objects Data Services (BODS) et Informatica. Avoir démontré la capacité d’assimiler de nouveaux outils et technologies. Avoir une connaissance du cycle de vie de développement d’une application. Capacité de concevoir les besoins du client et de les traduire en stratégies d’implémentation bien spécifiques. Capacité à travailler de manière autonome ainsi qu’au sein d’une équipe. Expérience et connaissance de gestion de données, modélisation de données, DataMart, DataWarehouse, développement ETL, MDX, OLAP.

description:
GALE is a business agency headquartered in New York with offices in Toronto and Bangalore. We’re passionate about delivering data-driven actionable insights, game changing creative, and top-tier technology to fuel great experiences. Our team is connected by a set of core values that are important to us, and should be important to you. We’re driven by a passion to build something great, a desire to innovate, and a belief that our people should be treated like individuals, not resources.We have killer office locations in New York, Toronto, and Bangalore. We offer an emphasis on growth and professional development, good benefits, and a flexible and fun working environment. We’re looking for great people to join our team!As a Front End Developer you are both technical and creative. You are the glue that holds the design and the technology together by bringing to life the killer creative and experiences that we design. You create pixel perfect, reusable, extensible, flexible, high-performing front-end experiences that integrate seamlessly with back-end code. You are passionate about coding in React.js, HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript … especially JavaScript frameworks and UI Libraries. You have experience working with one or more of these modern frameworks and libraries like Vue.js, React.js and Angular you know the landscape changes in lightning speed so you constantly keep yourself up-to-date experimenting with new frameworks.   Who you are: Post secondary education in Computer Science or equivalent In-depth understanding of asynchronous code, call backs, and promises Strong experience using front-end frameworks (React.js, React Native, Redux, HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Node etc.) Familiarity with the MVC pattern Some Knowledge of web standards, SEO and accessibility Asset if you have experience integrating front-end code with backend services (web services, RESTful services, JSON, XML,    web sockets) Knowledge of responsive design methodologies Knowledge of CSS pre-processors like LESS or SASS is an asset JavaScript unit testing frameworks like Jasmine is an asset Ability to articulate and explain details around web development basics like browser security issues, iframe to iframe       communication, https requests, CORS What you will be doing:  Design and develop front-end and mobile applications using React.js and React Native  Develop front-end code that adheres to architectural guidelines (secure, high-performing, scalable, extensible, flexible, simple) Understand business requirements and turn them into technical designs Understand style guides and turn them into front-end code- Understand information architecture and visual designs and turn them into front end code Understand backend interfaces and develop front-end code that integrates with those interfaces- Execute in a test driven development environment, writing unit tests and building code to pass unit tests Execute in an agile environment using industry standard tools and delivering weekly code releases- Understand cross browser, cross platform development issues and solutions Estimate for design and development effort

title: Release Engineer
description:
As a Release Engineer, you will help manage our source control systems, automate builds and regression testing, create tools and monitoring around all builds, and make sure all builds are done in a consistent and repeatable fashion.  This role will require working with development, operations, and product teams to help coordinate the delivery of our features in a way which guarantees the highest amount of quality and performance.  You will be an advocate of continuous delivery practices and help evangelize it throughout the company.  This is a very important role! What You Will Do: •       Support and improve our tools for continuous integration, automated testing and release management. •       Own and operate the deployment tools and processes in collaboration with development team •       Develop strategy to implement, improve and support continuous deployment •       Write code to automate all aspects of the system •       Define, measure and publish key release metrics and monitoring criteria •       Work closely with the engineering team to evolve the application deployment architecture that can scale to support microservices. Must Have: •       BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience •       At least 2 years experience in software engineering, release engineering, and/or configuration management •       Strong familiarity with software configuration management systems and/or source code version control systems like Git •       Experience with continuous delivery, pipelines, traceability, visualization, and automation around builds •       Skill with one or more scripting languages such as Python/Bash/Ruby/Go •       Experience with JVM languages and build tools like Java, Groovy, Maven, Gradle, Grunt •       Knowledge of measurement and monitoring tools like Graphite, New Relic, Nagios, Sensu •       Extensive knowledge of Unix/Linux Nice to Have: •       Understanding of TCP/IP stack •       Familiarity microservice architecture - the good, bad and ugly. •       Experience with containers (Docker, rkt) and schedulers (Mesos, Kubernetes, Nomad) •       Familiarity with general security and vulnerability management

    About the job    


Do you want to join one of the leaders in the financial services industry developing User Interface (UI) solutions for clients and employees? Then join the global leader in Digital and web application solutions for the insurance and financial services industry and become part of our Creative UI revolution. Deskside Support
Information Technology

Calian

                  Gatineau,
                Quebec      


    Deskside Support  Location: Gatineau, QC  Career #: 30741  Date Posted: 2017-05-16 Technical Support Analyst  Type of Assignment:  Contract, full-time, 6 months  Job Description:  Our client is looking for a deskside support specialists  Reporting to the Service Delivery Manager, End User Services, the Desk side Technician will be focused on providing local IT support our internal customer base. The candidate must have strong technical ability, problem solving skills, customer service, and a sense of ownership and accountability to provide the best possible support for our end-users. Bilingualism is required. The position also requires shift work (8 hour shifts) 5 days a week, between 7AM to 7PM. Must have some flexibility outside of regular schedule if needed for projects, dealing with an outage etc.  Experience supporting office automation tools in Microsoft products. (Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Internet Explorer, Microsoft Outlook). Troubleshoot incidents related to end-user devices i.e. laptops, desktops, cell phones, software, ip phones, printers, AV equipment, basic networking issues, etc.;  Resolve service requests i.e. software installations, how-to's etc.;  Performing daily operational procedures - manage their queue, update tickets etc.;  Various health and systems checks if required;  Setting up workstations including docking stations and monitors, plus installing applications;  Resetting user accounts for Active Directory, phone system, etc.  Mandatory Qualifications:   Minimum 5 years of experience with a focus in deskside services providing help desk support and analyzing technical issues.   Experience working on classified networks  Must be able to work a flexible rotating shift Mon-Fri 7AM-7PM;  Bilingual;  ITIL foundation and other industry certifications are desirable;  Demonstrates analytical, organizational, planning skills; oral and written communication skills;  Strong technical and problem solving ability;  Skill in coordinating activities, evaluating issues, and establishing priorities;  Ability to assume responsibility with minimal supervision;  Strong customer service orientation;  Basic knowledge of iPhones, iOS, ip telephony;  Good knowledge of Microsoft Environment - Active Directory, MS Office (Word, Excel, Access, Visio);  Familiar with basic network concepts.

Sap Security Consultant
Information Technology

Calian

                  Ottawa,
                Ontario      


    Sap Security Consultant  Location: Ottawa, ON  Career #: 28048  Date Posted: 2017-02-13  Type of Assignment:  Contract, full time Length of Assignment: 1 year  Job Description:  Our federal government client is looking a senior Sap Security consultant to perform the following duties  Recommend improvements and create functional and structural specifications for data integration.  Research, analyze and apply applicable SAP notes after the completion of the technical upgrade.   Contribute to and provide solutions to users from the strategic to the tactical level and identify the impact of new processes on the organization and works with others to understand the impact of change and prepare the business for change.  Develop guidelines and updates communication strategy for the management.   Responsible for unit testing of transaction codes and supported authorizations  Plan and design SAP security roles and responsibilities using single and composite roles methodology.   Perform unit testing in the development system and post production (landing checks) review of the transported or promoted changes in production.  Perform monitoring activities on the user accounts and accessibility to the production system to ensure compliance with SAP Security Directive.   Configure and maintain process-oriented SAP Security roles based on transaction codes, authorization objects, reports, and values as well as, maintained organizational levels in company codes, plants, purchasing group, work centers, personnel areas, and purchasing organizations as requested by Business Process Owners for day-to-day production support.   Provided second tier of technical representation and expertise for SAP Security Applications.  Create technical documentation on SAP Security blueprint design, Roles, Profiles and Authorizations development and configuration and ongoing support to the client  Develop functional specification to assist with the creation and maintenance of security processes, products, forms, reports, and work flows as required  Ensure that all of the business role-based security requirements are met by validating the configuration in the test environment  Mandatory Qualifications:   Musty have 8+ years of Sap experience.  The proposed resource must have implementation experience  Must hold a valid government security clearance.  Must have a minimum of 5 years of experience within the last 7 years building and maintaining SAP Security Roles.  Must have a minimum of 4 years of experience within the last 8 years working with SAP Security Authorization  Must have a minimum of 3 years of experience within the last 6 years, analyzing and implementing security and authorization upgrade task in SAP 4X system to ECC 6.0 or higher.  Must have a minimum of 5 years of experience within the last 8 years, analyzing and applying SAP OSS notes related to SAP security.  Experience in implementing Single-sign on (SSO).

title: Mobile Developer II
description:
Be digital, be mobile. You are passionate about technology and this digital era. You are an agent of change, looking forward to a meaningful and impactful role in life. You seek challenges, make mistakes, and live your life intensively. You work well with others; you listen but also speak your mind clearly. You see solutions instead of obstacles; you get inspired and try to inspire. You believe that change is possible, and you can make it happen. Sun Life Financial. Our employees account for some 27,000 professionals, with 3,000 in IT only. We thrive with challenges; we learn from each other and provide a rich environment where people can make their skills grow.Our clients are tech savvy citizens of a digital world. They use technologies to simplify their lives and are eager to adopt any new disruptive ones, setting high standards for us all.Our market is the world. Serving some 37 million clients across 26 countries, we adapt to local realities and leverage our world expertise to better serve each of them. Our products span across the insurance and financial worlds, providing peace of mind to millions, and helping many others attain their investments and retirement objectives, letting people worry for what is really important to them.Our employee benefits include an annual bonus program, pension plan, stock and savings programs, fitness and wellness benefits, flexible work arrangements, hands-on training and cross-functional project opportunities, education fund and eLearning, and the chance to gain international experience. Is there a fit? Join us at Sun Life Financials and continue building your futurePosition: Mobile Developer IIYour role

Develop mobile application for our internal and external clients.
Interface with Project Managers, System Designers, Business System Analysts, Application analysts and Testing Specialists to deliver high quality solutions
Be involved in projects from initiation to deployment, particularly during the development phase
Work on projects involving 3rd party and off-shore teams
Participate in the discovery and evaluation of new technologies.  Your background and skills
Bachelor's degree or equivalent education/experience
Ability to work in English
+2 years of experience with native mobile development on iOS and/or Android.
+3 years of software development experience.
Experience in interfacing with JSON/RESTful services
Experience in the web stack - HTML5, JS, CSS3, Ionic, etc.
Experience building native and hybrid app
Good analytical skills; able to assess alternatives, risks and benefits; attention to detail
Multi-tasker, customer and results focused
Teamwork - ability to work collaboratively with others (technical and non-technical)
Good communicator, self-motivated and service-oriented, a self-starter
Good organizational and time management skillsPersons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format, may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com

description:

Senior Electronics Designer
Engineering / Engineering Technology, Information Technology

CE3 Electronics Inc.

                  Moncton,
                  Dieppe,
                New Brunswick      


CE3 Electronics Inc. is a Canadian based electronics manufacturer located in Dieppe, NB. The company conducts business with OEM’s throughout North America. In addition to being a competitive North American CEM (Contract Electronics Manufacturer) facility, CE3 feels that the edge it has, is in providing comprehensive design support for its customers.  From offering the ability to modify or complete an existing design, to designing the next generation of a product, we provide an affordable alternative to design houses, with the objective being to keep the ongoing manufacturing in house at CE3.  The company has a proven record in electronics design and this is reflected in the significant level of production that is related to design initiatives. The entrepreneurial spirit of this department is a key element to its ongoing success.
CE3 Electronics Inc., is currently seeking an experienced, senior, electronics engineer/engineering technologist who will be responsible for front line design of electronics products. As such, you would be responsible for schematic design, programming, and test jig design of various existing or future products.  While we have significant expertise in the HVAC industry, we design for whatever the customer asks.  From Bluetooth and WIFI enabled Industrial controls to ultrasonic generators, lighting and other custom OEM design solutions.
The design team will consist of a PCB layouts expert, an electronics design engineer and a senior design engineer (yourself).
Responsibilities:

Working as a technical lead to develop or maintain existing electronic and software systems
Performing independently and as part of our team to develop design and production solutions
Leading technical meetings on design and process improvement, reviews and documentation
Assisting in the development, collection and reporting of metrics
Resource planning, cost estimation and task scheduling for proposal efforts
Keeping up to date with the everchanging electronics landscape

Required Education and Experience:

Bachelor of Science in Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent
5+ years of experience in design and/or manufacturing

Required Skills:

Electrical power and control systems design, simulation/analysis and real-time firmware development
Ability to work with Microchip, ST, Atmel and ARM families of controllers using C/C++
Schematics and PCB layout design using Autodesk EAGLE
Hands-on experience with a variety of advanced test equipment, board verification and repair
Self-motivated and highly organized to keep track of multiple projects; possess strong analytical and report writing skills as well as a professional and approachable demeanor
Excellent oral/written communication skills with the ability to present and explain technical information to both engineers and non-technical staff
Ability to manage stress and multiple conflicting priorities
Proficiency with IDEs including MPLAB- X, Eclipse, Visual Studio and MS Office Suite

To apply, please click on the Apply Now button.
Must be eligible to work in Canada to apply.

title: Opportunities for Project Managers
description:
PROJECT MANAGER 
 
J.D.
 Irving, Limited, Information Technology Division is the destination for
 collaborative, energetic and enthusiastic people excited about the 
customer experience, the internet of things, data, mobility and 
innovative solutions.  The IT Division is a strategic enabler leading 
the digital transformation of our diverse group of companies.  With over
 270 employees centralized in Saint John, Dieppe and Halifax, we offer 
our people the opportunity to engage in innovative projects delivering 
business value in a diverse environment.   We are driven to build the 
digital enterprise with technically enabled solutions in forestry, 
transportation, manufacturing, retail & distribution, shipbuilding 
and food processing.   Our IT team is proud to hire people with diverse 
skillsets and backgrounds and we expect and invest in continuous 
professional growth through strong career development and training 
programs.  As a key member of our team, your coworkers will be among the
 best in Maritimes ?that's why JDI.
 
Position Overview:  As the IT Project Manager,
 you will be responsible for leading the implementation of technology 
enabled business solutions for the J.D. Irving, Limited group of 
companies.  In this role, you will provide strong leadership in a 
dynamic and fast paced work environment towards enabling the growth and 
improvement of the businesses.
 
Job Responsibilities and Accountabilities:Lead
 the delivery of information technology projects into the J.D. Irving 
businesses through all stages of the project lifecycle from original 
concept to implementationChampion strong IT governance in the 
project management methodology and mentor project managers in its 
development and continuous improvementResponsible for all IT 
project requirements and artifacts, such as scope, schedule, cost, 
resourcing, risk, change and quality managementEnsure adherence to quality standards and review of project deliverablesManage the integration of vendor tasks and track and review vendor deliverablesManage communications related to the project at all levels of the organization and across businesses; including executive levelsProactively
 engage in coaching and mentoring of team members to help staff reach 
optimal level of performance and foster a working environment open to 
new ideas and innovative solutionsResponsible for all aspects 
of the development and implementation of assigned projects and provide a
 single point of contact for those projects
Position Requirements, Education and Experience:
Education Required: Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, or Engineering, MBA preferredYears of Experience Required: 3-5+ years of project management and IT experience with demonstrated career progressionProject Management Professional (PMP) designation or Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) designationProven
 track record of successfully leading and delivering major IT enabling 
projects, including ability to influence and facilitate working within 
and leading cross-functional teamsExcellent leadership, people 
and process management skills with proven success of optimizing delivery
 in a fast paced environmentAbility to organize, analyze, interpret and evaluate problems and provide solutions with the right sense of urgencyExceptional communication skills, both written and verbal at all levels within the organizationInfluence decision making of stakeholders with sound judgment and analytical support 
To Apply for this Career Opportunity: 
We appreciate your 
interest in our company!   Only those candidates selected for an 
interview will be contacted. 
 
To learn more about our products and services, click .  
 
  
 
J.D.
 Irving, Limited is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in 
its employment practices and to providing an environment free from 
discrimination and harassment for all employees.

title: IT Architect II
description:
Company Overview Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com Department Overview Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TDWe can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.TD IT Architecture covers TD's overall technology strategy, direction, standards for designing and/or developing an architecture framework including technology architecture strategy, policies, guiding principles and standards to govern how technology solutions will be developed and implemented across the organization. Architects typically develop and maintain any combination of the following: solution and application architecture, infrastructure environment architecture, technical integration architecture, data strategies and models, security and enterprise architecture.We're transforming the Payments space here at TD.TD's Enterprise Payments Technology Solutions team is a multi-functional, highly-adaptable group of experts that are currently deep in development of a broad Money Movement and Payments products suite. Right now, we deal with mainframe quite a bit with some distributed application footprint, and assume full accountability for technology strategy, project delivery, application support and technology portfolio management.Poised for significant growth in the distributed space, we're well immersed in more intriguing assignments behind-the-scenes in Enterprise Payments at this transformative point in TD's history. Some key initiatives in this space expose this team to cutting-edge technologies like API, Big Data and analytics, as well as emerging technologies in Mobile space such as NFC/BLE and wearable's. In short, this is the time and the place for those who want to stretch and harness their thinking.There's room to grow in all of it.Job Description About This RoleWe are looking for someone to develop and maintain architecture frameworks to support the most efficient, reliable, scalable and secure options to meet TD's business and technology strategy needs. Get ready to plan, evaluate, recommend and design architectural solutions while keeping within enterprise standards. It's your chance to participate in a whole new realm of learning and share what you know with others. The meaningful work involved here is all about protecting and enhancing security, technology availability, brand integrity and shareholder value.Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:  Assist in designing and developing an architecture framework to govern how solutions will be developed and implemented, including technology domain architecture strategy, policies, guiding principles and standards. Work with the team and other technology partners to understand security standards and risks, as well as ratify solution security design. Research and analyze business requirements to recommend optimal architecture solutions. Review and approve detailed solution architecture and design to comply with architectural and security standards, patterns and frameworks. Contribute to project plan development, offer input, manage projects and initiatives, direct assigned resources, communicate project status and ensure timely issue escalation. Participate as an expert and consultant on projects of moderate to high risk and complexity. Help develop a Requirement Traceability Matrix for end-to-end traceability (solution to requirements). Build consensus, facilitate collaboration and decision-making within and across business units so IT strategy application aligns with architecture framework. Ensure projects comply with technology domain architecture, design and operate processes to help review ongoing activity against technology architecture and development standards. Respect TD's technology delivery practices, standards and project management disciplines, including system requirements project documentation creation, cost and scope estimation. Support development, documentation, communication and execution of a comprehensive strategy, policies and solutions. Conduct pre- and post-implementation reviews to ensure solutions have met requirements, identify framework gaps, necessary enhancements, potential standards and patterns for future versions. Contribute to the technology standards decision-making process. Establish parameters for continued solution investments, provide technical risk analysis and assessment.   Requirements What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:  Undergraduate Degree or Technical Certificate. Graduate Degree preferred.  7+ years of proven experience in technical leadership roles on LARGE- scale transformational programs   You've been front-and-center when it comes to third-party product integration with legacy applications.   You have relevant experience, know-how and/or familiarity with:   Distributed and mainframe technology platforms.   REST/N-tier architecture.   Agile methodology and delivery practices.   Integration techniques including real-time web services (i.e. REST/JSON, SOAP/XML) and batch files.   J2EE Java development.   WebSphere/Jboss applications servers and other Open-source middleware components.     Experience with Hadoop big data systems is an asset.   You're well-versed and comfortable integrating with shared services (e.g. workflow, collaboration, document management, file management, etc.).   Ability to distill complex technical issues into easily understandable data points for consumption by non-technical leadership.   Experience in coaching and mentoring teams    Additional Information Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:  Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business. Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others. Communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical professionals. Cultivate winning relationships by building trust with business and technology partners. Share our commitment to productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency. Embrace change and witness amazing things happen - from the inside.  Make your mark. Join a dynamic team. Explore new ideas. This is your opportunity to impact the future of banking technology in areas and ways you've never imagined (at a bank)! Visit techjobs.td.com to learn more.Hours 9 to 5 Inclusiveness At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process(including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

    About the job    


    Company Overview Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. Here's our story: jobs.td.com Department Overview Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TDWe can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.TD IT Architecture covers TD's overall technology strategy, direction, standards for designing and/or developing an architecture framework including technology architecture strategy, policies, guiding principles and standards to govern how technology solutions will be developed and implemented across the organization. Architects typically develop and maintain any combination of the following: solution and application architecture, infrastructure environment architecture, technical integration architecture, data strategies and models, security and enterprise architecture.We're transforming the Payments space here at TD.TD's Enterprise Payments Technology Solutions team is a multi-functional, highly-adaptable group of experts that are currently deep in development of a broad Money Movement and Payments products suite. Right now, we deal with mainframe quite a bit with some distributed application footprint, and assume full accountability for technology strategy, project delivery, application support and technology portfolio management.Poised for significant growth in the distributed space, we're well immersed in more intriguing assignments behind-the-scenes in Enterprise Payments at this transformative point in TD's history. title: QA Tester
description:
Q/A TesterOn behalf of our client, Procom is currently seeking a Q/A Tester.As a QA Tester, you will ensure our products are delivered on time with high quality following our processes in place. We are looking for a QA Tester that have a high attention to detail, resourceful with strong collaborative skills to work on a high complexity claim adjudication system that involves using SQL, Web Services and Black Box testing skills.Q/A Tester Job Details- Perform Functional, Integration and Regression testing across multiple platforms, application frameworks, GUI and backend applications within a Health Adjudication Product- Perform manual testing on a complex system; utilizing claim log files, extracting data from database to cross reference against expected results within test scripts- Design, develop and maintain test plan and test cases utilizing project documentation including business requirements and system design to fully test that the solution satisfies the needs of the business- Assist with creating and maintaining a library of comprehensive regression scripts and maintaining appropriate archival of QA documentation- Ensure issues and defects are logged quickly and accurately while fixed defects are promptly verified and closed- Collaborate with Developers, Project Managers and Business Analysts to ensure that issues and risks are identified, logged and resolved- Create concise and information rich status reports and detailed estimates on assigned tasks- Provide testing support on UAT and Production issuesQ/A Tester Mandatory Skills- Continuous improvement of the processes and documentation worked with while maintaining commitments- Exceptional understanding of black box testing on multi-tier architectures- Strong understanding of database systems, proficient SQL skills, experience with Oracle and SQL databases- Solid understanding of SOAP Web Services- Experience writing and maintaining manual test plans, test cases and reporting test results independently- Exceptional knowledge of the Microsoft suite of products: Win XP, Outlook, SharePoint and MS Office focused on Excel- Knowledge of technologies such as Web Services, Java and GWT is an asset- Must have an extremely high level of attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple tasks- Exceptional communication skills, both written and oral; strong interpersonal and organizational skills- The ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities and unforeseen requests- Excellent problem-solving, analytical and time-management skills to prioritize and meet deadlines- Results oriented, focused on customer and team success as opposed to individual success- Bachelor degree or diploma in a computer science related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience- Minimum 5 years' experience in a QA role involving manual testing of complex medium to large scale systems- Experience preferred in the area of Dental and Extended Health Care Claim Management, engagement in projects in the health care industry and familiarity with health care standards would be idealQ/A Tester Job LocationCalgary, ABQ/A Tester Assignment Length6 Months

title: Application Development Lead
description:
One of clients at Talentcor, is one of the largest and well known insurance companies of the world, is seeking a Lead Application Developer to join their Salesforce solutions team for their operations in Waterloo, Ontario.Talentcor provides personalized, selective recruitment services for professionals seeking jobs in today's hottest fields. We help employers recruit and hire top talent for temporary, contract, and permanent career opportunities. Talentcor is a division of DGSI, the largest privately owned recruiting firm in Canada. DGSI has been consistently selected as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, earning Platinum Status, one of Canada's most elite business designations.Key Responsibilities:  Design and development of Salesforce.com (SFDC) solutions, ensuring all internal guidelines are met and standard processes are conducted Work in partnership with the business and technical areas to understand their needs, and to deliver quality solutions in a timely manner to address their business needs Suggest recommendations for process integration, application development, and ongoing enhancement of the new CRM (Customer Relationship Management) system  Requirements:   Proven ability to perform design, development, unit testing, implementation and documentation as it relates to Salesforce.com and Force.com applications Strong written and verbal communication skills to express ideas, thoughts and questions so that it can be understood by various audiences and meets the customers' needs  Ability to work independently or as part of a cross functional team to deliver effective solutions  Strong analysis and problem solving skills to breakdown high-level business requirements into more detail by questioning and probing for clarification  Good leadership, planning and consulting skills   Technical Skills and qualifications:   6+ years of design/development experience, including 3+ years in Information Technology

Procom Services

                  Montréal,
                Quebec      


Concepteur de construction réseau seniorDans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d'un Concepteur de construction réseau senior pour une entreprise dans le domaine des télécommunications. Notre client est situé à Montréal, Calgary, Toronto et Vancouver.Description des tâches et responsabilités - Concepteur de construction réseau senior- Expertisent Implantation et design sur les technologies: Cisco, Checkpoint, Netscaler, wifi;- Traduire les besoins en solutions approuvées par le Comité d'architecture;- Analyser les exigences du réseau et leurs impacts (LAN, WAN et SECURITY) dans le cadre des projets d'infrastructure;- Produire une documentation pour le bon fonctionnement de l'infrastructure (diagrammes, plan de mise en ?uvre, etc.) et le travail des techniciens et de l'équipe de support du service d'assistance;- Modifier les configurations d'équipements de télécommunications à partir des spécifications techniques du plan de mise en ?uvre;- Interface avec divers acteurs (architectes, PM, clients internes, opérations ...) concernant les projets, les implémentations et le soutien opérationnel;- Évaluer les résultats, les avantages et la qualité du service; ajuster le plan de réponse au besoin;Exigences du poste - Concepteur de construction réseau senior- Minimum de 5 ans d'expérience dans la gestion de grands réseaux complexes;- Connaissances pratiques étendues en réseaux (LAN / WAN) et télécommunications;- Connaissance du modèle OSI et des principaux protocoles et services réseau (TCP / IP, DNS, DHCP, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, RIP1 et 2, VLAN, VTP, Trunking, Port-Channeling, Spanning tree, etc.);- Connaissance approfondie de la gestion et du support des routeurs, des commutateurs, de l'équilibreur de charge et des pare-feu (Cisco, Checkpoint, Palo Alto, Citrix, etc.);- Connaissance approfondie de la gestion et du soutien de la téléphonie IP (Cisco).Atouts:- Connaissance des technologies sans fil;- Connaissance des mécanismes d'authentification (Radius, Tacacs, etc.);- Connaissance des technologies VPN (solutions d'accès à distance IPSec à divers sites clients);- Expérience dans la production de réseaux de conception;- Expérience dans la mise en ?uvre et le soutien des opérations de réseau.Type de posteContractuel 6 mois avec de fortes possibilités de renouvellementDate de débutImmédiatementNuméro de référenceBH 235104____________ENGLISH VERSION___________Build Network Designer SeniorOn behalf of your client Procom is searching for a Build Network Designer Senior for one of our client in the telecommunication sector. Our client is located in Montreal, Calgary, Toronto and Vancouver.Job Details - Build Network Designer Senior- Expertise Implantation et design sur les technologies : Cisco , Checkpoint, Netscaler, wifi;- Translate needs to solutions to be approved by the Architecture Committee;- Analyze network requirements and their impacts (LAN, WAN and SECURITY) in the context of infrastructure projects;- Produce documentation for the proper functioning of the infrastructure (diagrams, implementation plan, etc.) and the work of technicians and help desk support team;- Edit telecommunications equipment configurations from the technical specifications of the implementation plan;- Interface with various stakeholders (architects, PM, internal customer, operations...) concerning projects, implementations and operations support;- Evaluate the results, benefits and quality of service; adjust the response plan as required.Mandatory Skills - Build Network Designer Senior- Minimum 5 years' experience in managing large, complex networks;- Extensive hands-on knowledge in networks (LAN / WAN) and Telecommunications;- Knowledge of the OSI model and the main network protocols and services (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, RIP1&2, VLAN, VTP, Trunking, Port-Channeling, Spanning tree, etc.);- Thorough knowledge of the management and support of routers, switches, load balancer to and firewalls (Cisco, Checkpoint, Palo Alto, Citrix, etc.);- Thorough knowledge of the management and support of IP telephony (Cisco)Must have:- Knowledge of wireless technologies;- Knowledge of authentication mechanisms (Radius, Tacacs, etc.);- Knowledge of VPN technologies (IPSec remote access solutions to various customer sites);- Experience in producing network designs;- Experience in the implementation and support of network operationsAssignment Length6 months Contract - RenewableStart dateImmediatelyReference numberBH 235104

description:

Senior Director Enterprise Architecture
Information Technology

Procom Services

                  Calgary,
                Alberta      


Senior Director Enterprise ArchitectureOn behalf of our client, Procom is looking for a Senior Director Enterprise Architecture who will be responsible for leading a team of highly skilled enterprise architects in the development and delivery of Enterprise Architecture strategies; roadmaps and artefacts that direct action. You will be responsible for engaging senior business executives and IS leaders in road mapping sessions; working collaboratively with other members of the IS team, process owners and subject matter experts; facilitating business process analysis and design sessions as needed to produce the overall IS roadmap. Senior Director Enterprise Architecture Job Details- Maintain in-depth knowledge of strategic business plans and seek ways to apply new and emerging technology to assist our client in achieving its business goals and strategies;- Provide guidelines for the business process analyst (often just called business analyst) to follow when determining the current "as-is" state of a business process, and maintain current-state business process documentation;- Develop and maintain an aspirational architectural road map for the enterprise. Monitor progress towards this roadmap and identify changes to initiatives/projects as needed to achieve it;- Drive IS strategy development, including environmental analysis, opportunity identification, value cases and business innovation portfolio development;- Lead enterprise architecture development; including business, information, application and infrastructure architectures;- Identify opportunities for the development of cross-LOB solutions that combine knowledge of the target business architecture, general technological options, and process facilitation techniques;- Ensure enterprise wide information and technology standards are enforced when designing the future-state of business processes;- Provide architectural direction to Business Architects; Domain and Solution Architects while managing a team of enterprise architects;- Provide architecture guidance and direction to senior IS and Business executives as needed to ensure alignment between business goals and the overall IS portfolio;- Work with the Portfolio management team to ensure that all proposed projects remain aligned with the overall IS application, information and infrastructure roadmaps.Senior Director Enterprise Architecture Mandatory Skills- Degree or equivalent in Management Information Systems, Engineering or Computer Science;- Knowledge of process improvement approaches; - 15-20 years of experience in IS;- Comprehensive knowledge of facilitation and organization change management;- Ability to adapt to rapidly changing technology and apply it to business needs;- Ability to establish and maintain a high level of trust and confidence with all stakeholders - both business and IS leaders; management and staff;- Strong analytical and conceptual skills; ability to create original concepts for a variety of projects.- Conceptual knowledge of new, and emerging, computing architectures;- Management experience in two or more of the following areas: - Strategic planning, leadership and relationship management; - Program management efforts involving the coordination of resources and goals across multiple related projects; - Leading multidiscipline, high-performance work teams; - Developing and monitoring delivery of efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems;- Understanding of business process management, workflow and integration methods and tools;- Knowledge of finance, accounting, valuation and metrics development;- Critical thinking and problem solving - The ability to create original concepts and theories for a variety of projects, and to think creatively and beyond normal constraints;- Teaching/educating/coaching/mentoring stakeholders to reinforce a mentality of continuous process improvement;- The ability to translate business goals and metrics into business process outcomes;- Ability to lead and manage high-performing virtual teams;- Knowledgeable in designing and constructing business processes, functions and organizational structures;- Ability to communicate with people at different levels, with diverse needs and agendas; related capabilities include facilitation and teaming skills;- Ability to analyze and balance the needs of project delivery with the needs of the overall enterprise; both in the short and long term;- Ability to identify emerging technology that can add business value and it's implication on our client; - Ability to work with business stakeholders to modify business practices to take full advantage of technology innovation; - Ability to quickly develop a sound understanding of the business operating model; strategies and the rail industry;- Knowledge of finance, accounting, valuation and metrics development; possessing statistical analysis skills;- Strongly influential and charismatic, especially with decision makers and operational teams;- Highly collaborative;- Possesses strong intellectual integrity;- Respected as a leader;- More interested in business results than personal preferences.Senior Director Enterprise Architecture Start DateASAPSenior Director Enterprise Architecture LocationCalgary, AB
