Conseiller en sécurité des TI Senior / IT Security Consultant Senior
Information Technology

Procom Services

                  Montréal,
                Quebec      


IT Security Consultant (Senior-Bilingual)Procom is seeking a Senior IT Security Consultant for a contract opportunity with our client in Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal, Vancouver, or CalgaryIT Security Consultant (Senior) ResponsibilitiesThe ideal candidate will lead and deliver a variety of security related technology projects on time, on budget, while exceeding customer expectations. The senior security consultant will ensure the best possible experience for both internal and external customers as well as be responsible for multiple simultaneous projects, with project management support. Responsibilities: The candidate will be involved on customer facing projects to support the requirements gathering, design, deployment, configuration, integration and tuning of security appliances and software such as Cisco ASA / PAN / Check Point / Juniper Firewalls. Specifically, the role will be responsible to:  Configure, install and integrate security technologies in customer environments.  Perform platform performance health checks, tuning and optimization.  Design and capacity plan complex and multi-vendor security solutions.  Performing content and filter development to identify data, and events of interest.  Configure standard and custom alerting, correlation and notifications.  Develop standard and custom reports to support customer requirements, including compliance-driven reporting.  Support SE's during presales phase and participates on Proof of Concept and Pilot engagements.  Provide quality knowledge transfer and documentation.IT Security Consultant (Senior) SkillsRequired Knowledge:  Solid knowledge of Cisco ASA / PAN / Check Point / Juniper firewall products as well as functional and design concepts across entire information management lifecycle.  Absolute must have advanced hands-on deployment and configuration experience with Cisco ASA / PAN / Check Point / Juniper firewalls within medium and large enterprises.  Demonstrated experience to support the listed candidate responsibilities.  Strongly preferred vendor certifications:  Cisco ASA, PAN, Juniper, CheckPoint, etc. Industry information security certifications an asset:  CISA, CISM, CRISC, C|CISO  CISSP, SANS/GIAC  SABSA Required Skills & Abilities:  Bilingual (French/English)  Demonstrates a high level of self-motivation and accountability on technical projects in a highly competitive environment to ensure timely execution, clear communication of risks, and profitable delivery with limited direct supervision.  Exercises and exhibits leadership by planning, organizing, scheduling, coordinating the work of others; providing advice, guidance, direction; developing repeatable work methods, standards and other internal procedures.  Resolves problems that are diversified and complex and frequently involve new issues that may not have been encountered before.  Makes timely and logical decisions in analyzing diverse information streams, evaluating options and formulating recommendations in order to resolve problems.  Excellent communicator: technical writing, design consultation and presentation skills.  Committed to continuous personal development to maintain and enhance technical security knowledge.  Some travel may be necessary to support customer projects. Required Experience: The candidate will possess the following experience:  Minimum 10 years in information technology industry.  Minimum 5 years focus in information security.  Minimum 2-3 years hands-on Cisco ASA / PAN / Check Point / Juniper Firewalls installation and deployment experience.IT Security Consultant (Senior) Start DateASAPIT Security Consultant (Senior) Duration6 Month Contract

Excellent communicator: technical writing, design consultation and presentation skills.  Committed to continuous personal development to maintain and enhance technical security knowledge.  Some travel may be necessary to support customer projects. Required Experience: The candidate will possess the following experience:  Minimum 10 years in information technology industry.  Minimum 5 years focus in information security.  Minimum 2-3 years hands-on Cisco ASA / PAN / Check Point / Juniper Firewalls installation and deployment experience.IT Security Consultant (Senior) Start DateASAPIT Security Consultant (Senior) Duration6 Month Contract

Change Request QA Lead On behalf of our client in the Healthcare industry, Procom Consultants Group is currently searching for a Change Request QA Lead to help our client manage multiple concurrent clinical projects.Change Request QA Lead Job Details:  Performing quality assurance reviews of project proposals and change requests in order to ensure that the proposals / change requests align with BCCSS standard templates / terms, have all required information / terms & conditions, utilize proper grammar / spelling, and to verify that the estimate cost calculations are correct Interfacing with Portfolio Managers and Technical Project Managers to communicate any changes / issues, and areas that require further clarification, which are identified during the proposal / change request review Identify and implement project in-take and proposal / change request process & template improvements Produce and maintain proposal / change request language / terms & conditions / document repositories, with input from Portfolio Managers / SME's, to improve the content and consistency of project proposalsChange Request QA Lead Mandatory Skills: 2+ years' experience performing quality assurance reviews on IT infrastructure project proposals and change requests, in areas such as servers, storage, data networks, IP telephony (VoIP / PBX), wireless networks, and workstation / output device installations & moves, working in a high volume project proposal / change request development environment 3+ years' experience solutioning / developing project proposals for IT infrastructure projects Strong written and verbal communication skills Keen attention to detail Experience with the delivery of IT infrastructure projects would be beneficialChange Request QA Lead Start Date:ASAPChange Request QA Lead Assignment length:September 30th, 2017 with extensions

Situé dans la ville de Québec, notre client ?uvre dans le secteur des assurances.Description des tâches et responsabilités - Technicien en informatique niveau 3 / Administrateur de serveurs***Nous recherchons des personnes qui ont de l'expérience dans l'administration des serveurs et qui ont une très bonne maîtrise des technologies Microsoft IIS ***Responsabilités :- Procéder à la mise en place, configuration et diagnostic de site web sous différentes technologies (IIS et autres)- Procéder à la mise en ?uvre des demandes d'installation, de configuration et de mise à niveau de logiciels qui requièrent des connaissances d'ordre technique ou des domaines d'affaires.- Offrir un soutien technique pour les incidents informatiques ou technologiques rapportés par les usagers ou pour les demandes de service de nature complexe et qui requièrent des connaissances approfondies d'ordre technique ou des domaines d'affaires.- Analyser, effectuer les recherches nécessaires, diagnostiquer et documenter les problèmes.- Résoudre les incidents ou traiter les demandes de service selon les normes établies et les acheminer à un autre intervenant, lorsque requis.- Participer aux activités de rédaction des documents selon les normes établies.- Identifier et communiquer les opportunités d'amélioration.- Collaborer au développement et au déploiement de programmes ou outils permettant d'accroître l'efficacité, la performance, la sécurité et la stabilité opérationnelle.- Voir à la conservation et la mise à jour des données et de la documentation utilisées pour l'installation et la configuration des équipements ou logiciels.Exigences du poste - Technicien informatique Niveau 3 / Administrateur de serveurs- Diplôme d'études collégiales en technologie ou pertinent avec l'emploi- Trois (3) années d'expérience pertinentes dans l'administration de serveurs- Maîtrise et expérience avec les intergiciels (middlewares) Microsoft (IIS)- Le candidat doit avoir les connaissances et l'expérience dans la mise en place, configuration et diagnostique de site web sous différentes technologies- Connaissance du scripting et de la ligne de commande (DOS)- Connaissance du processus ITIL- Être orienté vers le client- Faire preuve de rigueur professionnelle et de minutie- Faire preuve d'autonomieAtout :Connaissance de Sharepoint (atout)Connaissance du scripting et de la ligne de commande UNIX (atout)Connaissance des intergiciels Java (Weblogic, JBoss, etc.) (atout)Connaissance de l'anglais (atout)Type de posteContractuel 12 moisDate de débutRapidementNuméro de référenceBH 235448

title: Mobile UX Architect
description:
Our client is one of the largest and most reputable insurance companies in the world. They are seeking a lead Mobile UX (User Experience) Architect to join their Digital User Experience team in their Canadian operations. You will be working closely with stakeholders in various business units to ensure a remarkable and progressive digital experience for the client ensuring delivery of their key success factors.Talentcor provides personalized, selective recruitment services for professionals seeking jobs in today's hottest fields. We help employers recruit and hire top talent for temporary, contract, and permanent career opportunities. Talentcor is a division of DGSI, the largest privately owned recruiting firm in Canada. DGSI has been consistently selected as one of Canada's 50 Best Managed Companies, earning Platinum Status, one of this country's most elite business designations. Key Responsibilities:   Lead the design of UI (User Interface) and all related digital features for their web, mobile and social channels Consistent use of sound interaction design principles to influence project strategy and direction Define creative user interfaces and interaction styles to improve and provide a better user experience for their mobile, web and social channels Take a lead role to drive the UX strategy; act as an evangelist for the company's UX practices Develop and maintain user personas, scenarios, user flows, design concepts, wireframes, prototypes, UI Standard documents, navigation maps and other related documents as required Devise and conduct user research and testing to validate contemporary ideas and refine designs Ensuring all best practices as well as standards are appropriately communicated and documented Manage UX deliverables as produced by internal and 3 rd party resources to ensure all targets and expectations are successfully met Lead and produce annotated wireframes and all related documentation required within project deadlines Ensure the workflow reflects the user's needs and maintain consistency among features Determine the need for user research and testing; then orchestrate and oversee the whole process. Interpret and review research findings for presentations to project teams   Qualifications:   Minimum of 5 - 7 years of design/user experience with a strong focus on user-centered mobile design University degree or certification in User Experience related field or equivalent work experience Solid portfolio demonstrating impactful customer experiences, including experience developing digital products from initial concept through to implementation. Design experience ranging across web, mobile (mobile web and native applications) and social channels Strong knowledge and experience designing wireframes and interactive prototypes using industry software (e.g. Axure, Balsamiq, Sketch, InVision) Well versed in current accessibility standards Proven track record and a passion for designing compelling, award-winning user interfaces Excellent design, verbal, writing and presentation skills Experience working with clients and various departments within a team environment Solid understanding of front-end web development (HTML, CSS, JS, etc.) Knowledge of current web standards and the latest trends Ability to successfully manage and deliver on multiple projects with competing deadlines and priorities Knowledge and experience in Agile project methodology is an asset  Apply: Please apply directly online or submit your resume to Muhammad Yahya, myahya@talentcor.comTalentcor would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive we are only able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement processAlternate format available upon request.We encourage you to visit www.talentcor.com regularly as new and exciting employment opportunities become available daily!

title: Intermediate SQLServer DBA
Mainframe Developer
description:
Eagle is currently seeking a Mainframe Developer for a twelve (12) month contract position, scheduled to begin immediately.Key ResponsibilitiesThe successful candidate will be responsible for:Detailed technical designing, developing and maintaining of applications on mainframe platforms Design and code program;Creating test transactions and run tests;Conducting analysis of needs and goals for the development and implementation of applications systems;Reviewing, analyzing and modifying programming systems including encoding, testing, debugging and installation;Establishing disaster recovery plan;Maintaining online and batch applications;Developing detailed design specifications, creating and reviewing code and assess impact on other applications;Working closely with other team members to ensure consistency in coding standards and approaches and to optimize any synergy and re-use opportunities;Leading technical aspects of project from inception through to deployment;Participating in analysis and system design specification sessions;Documenting of design options and solutions according to System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology;Ensuring that solutions adhere to development best practices and architectural principles;Applying analytical skills to resolve problems and deliver viable solutions;Anticipating obstacles and executing proactive approaches to issues;Active participation in issue resolution;Providing detailed development estimates to Project Manager for development effort as well as weekly status reporting and budget forecasting and,Data set up and environment shake down along with the coaching / mentoring of junior developers.Skills and QualificationsThe successful candidate must have:Degree/Certifications Required: Bachelor’s Degree;10 years with VSAM, DB2, IMS, MQ, COBOL, JCL/Procedures;10 years with general IBM mainframe skills; 5 years with mainframe interface; 10 years with analysis, design, coding, testing and implementation and, 5 years with banking and financial.Don't miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

title: Intermediate Windows/Linux Systems Administrator
description:
﻿Intermediate Windows/Linux Systems AdministratorDo you have what it takes to keep the Systems up to date and operating to their full potential? Do you have the desire to learn mentor and grow? Are you seeking a stable work environment to grow and put your skills to good use?  If so please read on….. Our client located in the Kitchener-Waterloo area is seeking a highly motivated Intermediate Linux/Windows Systems Administrator to join their growing team. The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate the ability to implement, document and maintain the Systems in a high availability environment.  Responsibilities:·         Providing technical support·         Server building and administration·         Installing system patching and upgrades·         Backup and recovery·         Monitoring and troubleshooting·         Development and implementation of resolutions·         Collaborate with other teams and vendors ·         Develop and maintain technical documentation  Skills:·         3-5 years of experience in System Administration in windows and Linux·         Experience with Windows Server 2008/2012·         Understanding of TCP/IPv4 networking·         Excellent troubleshooting skills ·         Expert in OS implementations·         Strong experience with Active Directory, Exchange, Windows 7/8 and Red Hat Linux·         Experience with SAN storage·         Degree in Computer Science or equivalent  This is an incredible opportunity for the right individual. If you are interested, please send in your resume in complete confidence to my email address or contact me in the office for more information.   Kelly Dewling 647 484 1411 kdewling@pmcrecruitment.ca   Should you or others you know wish to inquire about other roles within the IT industry please don’t hesitate in contacting us on:   

					About PMC SPECIALIST RECRUITMENT SOLUTIONS - IT SOLUTIONS
				PMC Specialist Recruitment IT Solutions specializes in the recruitment of Information Technologies professionals.  Our networks are deeply entrenched in the IT market and focused on meeting the goals and objectives of clients and candidates locally and nationally.  Our resources match qualified candidates for the whole cycle in IT, from inception of a project through to support, and all levels of seniority, from developers to CTOs.

Our specialty is partnering with organizations to source, screen and interview potential candidates towards their requirements while proactively representing design and construction professionals in search of their career goals and objectives.

Our clients include numerous organizations across these business verticals:Digital Media, Mobile, and GamingFinancial Services and InsuranceHealthcareManufacturing and LogisticsPublic and Not For ProfitProfessional Services and Software VendorsRetailStart upsTelecommunications
 
Our proactive and consultative approach has been able to provide value added services to both clients and candidates.  We look forward to working with you.

title: Front End Consultant (javaScript ReactJS)
description:
Contract Position - Mississauga Hiring a Front End Javascript Consultant (Contract) in Mississauga, Ontario! In this role, you will be developing in a agile environment. Along with coding, you will be responsible for working with product managers, developers and designers on a scrum team. Our client loves developers who lead the charge, communicating with customers and delivering the most beautiful, intuitive application possible is a must.Perks You'll Love* Work in a collaborative, fun work culture* Fast-paced environment using cutting edge technology* Listed as one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies To Work For”Required Skills and Experience* BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent industry experience* Professional or open-source experience utilizing React framework* C#/WPF (at least 4 years of experience* JavaScript (at least 3 years of experience)* Ability to take prototypes and implement them in java script/react and deploy them production ready for beta testing* Familiarity with standard javascript async patterns (closures, callbacks, promises, error handling, etc.)* Never ending desire to self-educate on the latest list of web technologies like HTML, CSS, javascript frameworks and bleeding edge browser features/idiosyncrasiesOther Appreciated Skills* Experience with Git and GitHub* Passion for user experience and strong design experienceWe Are An Equal Opportunity EmployerAll qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.Canadian Work AuthorizationAll applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Responsibilities include the development and maintenance of the company’s mobile application, such as new feature development, research initiatives, etc. Known for their innovative technology and considerable growth, this exciting startup is making waves in the Ottawa technology community.    About YouThe ideal candidate will have:·         Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Software Engineering or an equivalent·         5+ years of software development experience, with 3+ years of native iOS mobile development in Objective-C or Swift (preferred).·         Concrete experience building and launching mobile applications into an app store·         Experience and willingness to test your own code·         Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and ability to work both in a team and autonomous environment.Attitude and aptitude takes precedence over a perfect technical match. Salary RangeSalary is commensurate on experience, and is an addition to an excellent perks/benefits package. How to Apply Please apply by clicking the “Apply” button below and follow the link to submit your résumé. title: Senior Support Analyst
description:
Our GTA client is currently seeking a Senior Support Analyst for long term contractDuties include:• Maintenance of servers – Testing and installation of operating system and application patches for Windows and Linux environments in a VMWare Virtual Environment both on and off regular business hours• Daily verification of system and SQL backups using VEEAM• User Maintenance – Linux, Dynamics GP, Alert, CRM, Email, RDS• Maintenance of File and Print servers• Perform end user support for all hardware (Lenovo desktops/laptops, and various printer models) and software (operating systems, MS Office, Visio, AutoCad, etc.) for local and remote employees• End user support for Avaya IP Office telephone system• Perform backend setup, configuration and maintenance activities for SQL Server and MySQL Server• Installation and maintenance of antivirus, malware, threat prevention software• Purchasing and installation of new hardware and software• Daily monitoring of network and server performance Education/Knowledge•            VMWare and Hyper-V•            VEEAM Backup Software•            Windows Server Environments: 2003 – 2016•            Windows Desktop Environments: Windows 7 and 10•            Linux Environments: Ubuntu 12.04 – 16.04•            Networking: DNS, DHCP, Wireless•            Databases:  SQL Server  and mySQL Server (backend only: installation, security, backup )•            Web Server Environments – IIS and Apache Ideal candidate would have experience with:-            Active Directory-            Exchange-            System Upgrades-            Anti-virus-            NetworkingWe are seeking a motivated applicant with excellent communication skills and customer service focus.For immediate consideration, don’t delay, please apply online today!Randstad Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. title: Permanent Placement Consultant
description:
Do you love solving puzzles? Can you build a network of talented individuals? Are you a competitive person who is driven to help others? If you answered YES to any of these questions, our Toronto office is the place for you!Eagle needs a Permanent Placement Consultant for either 360 desks (full cycle sales and recruiting) or pure permanent placement delivery to join our growing team of exceptional consultants. Your analytical skills will be put to the test as you help candidates find the right role and make a difference in their lives.  To be successful in our dynamic environment you must have some recruitment experience (preferably permanent placement) from either a corporate or agency environment. You'll need to approach each new role with a keen sense of urgency and demonstrate your effective communication skills. Your proven investigative abilities, outstanding business acumen and a natural need to WIN will get you in our door!What’s in it for you? A workplace culture that can’t be beat!Savour our daily breakfast program so you can start your day on the right track;Join the team atmosphere with regular team social events;Balance your life with our innovative WORKshift program;Receive peer-to-peer recognition and reach for Top Performer status through your achievements and teamwork;Celebrate your birthday and your cultural background with 2 extra paid days off;Contribute to our in-house Charity Program and give back to your community with a paid volunteer day;Participate in our industry-recognized training and development program customized just for you.Work in one of 2017’s Certified “Best Workplaces in Canada"— our environment is friendly and fast-paced.  Join a recruiting team that focuses on winning, learning, teamwork and fun – you’ll love to be a part of it!Eagle Professional Resources Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

If so, this role could be a fit for you!Perks You'll Enjoy as Mobile Developer* Competitive health & dental benefits* Fantastic culture, including free snacks & catered lunch each day* Tackle cool projects in a growth-focused environment* Ranked in the Top 50 Companies to Watch by DeloitteMain Responsibilities* Working effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment* Maintaining & improving the iOS or Android application used by over a million students* Implementing new features for the client's tablet and mobile apps* Regularly improving application performance and reliability, and as required, providing solutions to any issues* Working alongside the client's design and backend teams to design fast, reliable and beautiful mobile apps* Strong technical knowledge of REST APIs, Django, Node.js, AWS and MySQL* Regularly contributing ideas to the design & planning processRequired Skills & Experience* Several years of development experience and strong technical mastery on at least one of the iOS or Android platforms* Must be able to provide technical leadership to the team* Technical undergraduate degree (ie. computer science/engineering)* Strong current knowledge of iOS or Android development technologies and tools* Mobile network programming (client-server)* REST APIs* Git* Automated unit and integration testingAbout UsFounded in 1999, TAL Group is one of Toronto’s leading IT & Mobile Recruitment Agencies. title: Application Architect
description:
We are looking for an application s architect for a 4-8 months contract role with OPS. The successful candidate will need to have prior OPS experience. The Business Directory(BD) application requires an Application Architect to design and document the upgrade to the BD application architecture to accommodate the Canada Revenue Agency(CRA)'s schema changes scheduled for October 2017. An application architect at GSIC is required to design and upade the upgrade to the BD architecture and the BD Partner schema changes.Work is in an IBM WebSphere environment, using Java technologies including WebSphere Process Server. Work will be completed on-site. Resource will work within a technical team and report to the Project Manager.The role is downtown.Required skills:  • 10+ years’ of demonstrated competency and experience in implementing physical infrastructure environments and integrating IBM WebSphere Portal, IBM WebSphere process server, WebSphere Application Server, and Oracle DB.• 10+ years of experience in the development of internet/intranet applications of enterprise-wide large, medium or small size, multi platform, n-tier, multi component applications• 10+ years’ of experience in enterprise application development focused around the use of features such as SOA, Service BUS, Identity service, Single Sign On, Digital Identity, Identity Access management, communication, interface, Omni-channel design, access control, web services, JAVA, J2EE, SAML, and J2EE security.• Demonstrated experience with providing application and security architecture for complex enterprise- wide projects•  10+ years’ of experience in enterprise application development focused around the use of features such as SOA, Service BUS, Identity service, Single Sign On, Digital Identity, Identity Access management, communication, interface, Omni-channel design, access control, web services, JAVA, J2EE, SAML, and J2EE security.• Demonstrated experience with providing application and security architecture for complex enterprise- wide projects• Demonstrated architecture experience with business process management applications, specifically with  Java/BPEL• Demonstrated architecture experience with business process management applications, specifically with  Java/BPEL• Demonstrated experience with setting up workshops with the business users• Demonstrate strong communication, facilitation, negotiation, consensus building and problem solving skills• Demonstrated competency and experience with the Zachman framework• Demonstrated knowledge and experience with business/information/application/ technology/security architectures with enterprise architecture.• Demonstrated knowledge and experience with World Wide Web Consortium Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0, Level AA, and how they apply to programming and user interface• Experience with the OPS Enterprise Architecture Approval process (ACT/ARB) and the OPS IT gating process.• Knowledge and experience with the applications within the Shared Utility Service (SUS).• Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of diverse business environments, especially government environments, with a strong understanding of the business drivers within these environments

title: Web Developer
description:
Wanted: Web Developer for Full-Time Salary Position — with Overtime Pay + Benefits!  About Us: We’re a busy midtown Toronto based advertising agency that’s been in business for over 40 years.  It’s our mission to provide our clients with the most innovative, inspiring and effective web content on the planet. That’s why we’re looking for you — a highly motivated Web Developer with a well-developed skill set and an innovation mindset — to be the latest member of our Web Development Team!   About You:  You love working in an environment where your perspective and your time is valued, and where your good work is recognized and rewarded.  While you have extensive experience with current best practices, you’re also always working to maintain a comprehensive understanding of all the latest web and related technologies, languages, programs and platforms. In addition to web development, you’re also familiar with best practices for developing for touch screens, interactive documents and other related platforms.  Even though you have a great eye for detail and a drive for perfection, you also never lose sight of the fact that meeting deadlines is the top priority.  You are comfortable taking constructive criticism, and thrive working in a supportive team-oriented environment.  While you excel at developing creative solutions to complex problems, you’re also able to explain your solutions to clients and team members in easy to understand, non-technical language.   When tight deadlines do need to be met, you are willing to work occasional (paid!) overtime to ensure that every new project is running flawlessly when it goes live.   Duties and responsibilities include: • Concept and develop web related projects for online rich media ad units, flash banner ads and some web design • Concept and execute motion design for enhanced Flash/animation experience • Able to take creative design direction and follow color, style, size, and placement guidelines specified during the initial design stage • Manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines with minimal supervision • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and willingness to build positive, professional working relationships with clients and staff• Accept constructive feedback willingly, be responsible and accountable for work, work with staff/clients to find workable solutions  Requirements:• 2+ years of web design and development experience• 2+ years experience with:  HTML / HTML5, CSS / CSS3, Javascript, jQuery, AJAX, Bootstrap & Responsive Grid Systems, PHP, MySQL and Domain, Web Hosting and Email Hosting management• 2+ years experience with: Wordpress & CMS, Adobe Dreamweaver, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Indesign, Adobe Acrobat, Microsoft Office Suite, Email marketing• 1+ years experience with: Angular and MVC Frameworks, Adobe Premiere Pro, Google Analytics, CRM Systems, Git or Version Control Software, Joomla• 1+ years experience in title: Back End Java Developer
description:
Job Description: This is an amazing opportunity to get in at the ground floor of a major technology / transformational shift in the banking industry.Our client is doing a complete re-platforming of their application development to be deployed and scaled on the CLOUD, on a unified basis across many business and operations channels. They will be creating the architecture for a new integrated Digital Banking Services platform. Essentially a PaaS (Platform as a Service). They are creating a highly efficient cross functional code delivery and deployment framework for shortening deployment times and providing increased developer productivity improvement (ie bleeding edge DevOps). Significantly digitizing banking services across channels and providing a new technology platform to redefine how the enterprise sells its services.Job Description:Our client has begun the journey to modernize both development practices and tools. One of the areas being explored is the public cloud and the various platform technologies that support both development and operations on the cloud. The aim is to reduce costs by providing a streamlined process and framework which will allow the development team to focus on building business logic. We are looking to build our development team with influencers, makers, creators and industry leaders who will drive us forward and enhance the experience of our customers.Responsibilities:• Designing, implementing and re-factoring code (typically Java, JavaScript, etc).• Participating in design discussions focused on scalability and design and implementation best practices.• Working with lead engineers and architects on breaking-down, scoping and estimating tasks.• Participating in planning and retrospective sessions, attending stand-ups, etc.• Be able to design, build and operate the software and infrastructure that keeps our solutions running.• Our teams are flexible and fast – you will be asked to provide leadership, mentorship, peer review and quality control on a daily basis.Required Skills & Abilities:• 3+ years of experience designing and implementing software.• Solid knowledge of at least one of the following programming languages: Java, JavaScript, etc• Experience designing and implementing RESTful services, good knowledge of HTTP specifics.• Knowledge of most common software design patterns.• Awareness of how scalable, enterprise-level software system is designed (both on code and infrastructure levels).• Experience working with relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).• Understanding of software release process (environments, binary repositories, CI/CD).• Attention to details, high standards for quality.• Desire to learn, grow yourself and your team.• Passion for driving teams towards high performance and a deep pride in quality craftsmanship that delights users.Bonus Skills:• Bachelor (equivalent or higher) degree in Computer Science.• Experience working with non-relational databases (MongoDB, GraphDB, etc.)• Experience designing and implementing mobile applications and services.• Good knowledge of various networking protocols and terminology (TCP/IP, gateways, routers, firewalls, etc.)• Experience designing and implementing cloud-based applications, awareness of main public cloud offerings (Microsoft Azure, AWS, GCE).• Experience working with scripting languages (Bash, PowerShell).• Experience working in Agile environment.Randstad Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach her/his potential. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification.As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Randstad Canada will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact your Randstad Recruiter/Consultant about your needs, and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

title: Technical Analyst - Sailpoint
description:
Accountabilities:1.	Work with the Business Client, Application Owners, and Access Governance to interpret and negotiate business requirements for system development projects into the LAM Factory.  Independently manage strategic initiatives to ensure the security controls of mission critical applications and networks are in compliance with ISS and Bank standards. Direct the utilization of technology to meet the strategic and tactical goals of the various organizational units supported by the department and identify opportunities and processes that will enhance the overall robustness and integrity of the systems infrastructure. Ensure a clearly articulated security strategy is in place to address the security requirements of Applications, Operating Systems, Firewalls, and Networks, and ensure security is implemented as per documented standards.2.	 Direct and guide project test teams to ensure the timely delivery of quality products/functions that are consistent with the business needs and priorities of our GIAM programs and downstream applications. Lead the analysis, design of business solutions; provide advice and guidance to project team. Collaborate with the project teams to ensure critical delivery dates are met for security reviews, server reviews, security patch rollouts and other time sensitive activities. 3.	Review business design documents and test plans to ensure that they are executed and updated accurately. Continually keep abreast of the rapidly changing technology environment, as well as new Bank and Divisional strategies and policies. Stay informed of EDP strategies, security and risk management policies, and government regulatory requirements, including back and Front Office processes in order to provide superior direction and guidance to staff, and to serve the user community effectively. Ensure communication with the remote sites globally is consistently maintained. 4.	Validate and document operational changes resulting from system projects/changes with the Business Client.5.	Participate in defining the business implementation approach working with the Business Client, Application owner and Access Governance.6.	Define the technical implementation of the LAM Factory approach with the Project Team and QAT lead.7.	Liaise with other areas of IT&S and IS&C team to complete our deliverables for Internal Audits, External Audits, Annual Sarbanes-Oxley certification and other regulatory reviews.8.	Continually improve processes which include: Overseeing the development and implementation of system and process enhancements.  Managing and maintaining software and support tools.  Creating and documenting new programs and internal procedures.Qualifications: -	Expertise in IT key controls and risk assessment concepts-	Typically has four to six years of experience-	University degree or college diploma in a related field is preferred-	Thorough knowledge of the Bank’s application and infrastructure environment-	Sound knowledge of regulatory requirements-	Advanced presentation and communication skills-	Active Directory/LDAP/I D Provisioning/Single Sign On-	Advanced Microsoft Project Skills-	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, information Systems or other related field. -	Experience with SailPoint IIQ -	Sailpoint IIQ – application onboarding experience including via file feed, direct connector, and AD. -	Java Script coding experience -	ITIL certification is an asset The incumbent must have a complete understanding of the relationship between complex GIAM application processes, and downstream applications, environmental resources, and code layering across multiple platforms.  This is a seasoned and specialized knowledge is acquired through hands-on experience with the business and technical dimensions of multifaceted projects within GIAM. The incumbent must have thorough working knowledge of the Sailpoint IIQ application including access request, certification process, and the application onboarding process. The incumbent must have a working knowledge of all aspects of Information Technology and industry practices as it relates to Identity and Access ManagementThe incumbent must have an expert understand of code library management and commands.  The incumbent must have excellent analytical, organizational, and communication skills (both written/verbal).The incumbent a solid understanding of change process, and related systems/technology to deliver code to QAT servers, controllers, and PC's with the ability to assess the risk and impact of the changes. The incumbent must have a complete understanding of the multiple QAT environments and their relationship to code delivery and business functions.  The incumbent must be results focused. Strategic influencing and thinking.The incumbent must be a results focused with self-awareness and personal development.The incumbent must be highly creative in identifying and researching technical solutions to resolve business problems. The incumbent must be able to take abstract concepts and apply them to formulate solutions and often work in variable, precedent setting situations requiring the ability to quickly identify and resolve unique problems. The incumbent must have detailed knowledge of all applications supported by the department in order to provide user support.The incumbent must keep current with rapidly changing technological trends and work with the GIAM team to provide recommendations on the future technological directions and architecture of the Divisions. The incumbent must have a broad knowledge of the Banks products, services, market trends, computer services, planning and control tools and organizational structure.Randstad Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach her/his potential. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification.As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Randstad Canada will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact your Randstad Recruiter/Consultant about your needs, and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

title: Organizational Change Management
description:
ONTARIO PUBLIC SECTOR CLIENT REQUIRES A SENIOR ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGE MANAGEMENT CONSULTANT FOR AN INITIAL TWELVE (12) MONTH CONTRACTANTICIPATED START DATE LATE JULY - EARLY AUGUSTEMPLOYMENT WILL BE SUBJECT TO SUCCESFUL COMPREHENSIVE BACKROUND CONDUCTED BY THE CLIENTKnowledge and/or Specific Experience and/or Background Education, Training, Certifications or DesignationsMandatoryan undergraduate degree in a relevant fieldSuccess in holding more than one, increasingly responsible position, focused on leading change throughout all levels of large, complex organizationsPreferredChange management certification or designationExperienceMandatory:•	A minimum of 10 years of advanced knowledge of change management principles and application within a large, complex environment, primarily outside of the information technology context•	Proven track record of strong written and oral communication and relationship-building skills with diverse business partners and stakeholders•	Experienced change agent, able to guide cross-functional teams through complex change from concept to execution•	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to identify concerns, gauge gaps and recommend an optimal approach is required•	Comprehensive knowledge of the practices, procedures and principles of project management•	Strong collaboration skills and experience working across a complex environment•	Demonstrated experience in identifying potential human resource risks and anticipated points of resistance, and success in recommending project change plans to mitigate or address these concerns•	Experience in recommending metrics to drive adoption and sustainment of change that link to the realization of project benefits; proven track record of developing a measurement strategy for same•	Experience in preparing readiness assessments and evaluation of results•	Track record in implementing creative and organizationally appropriate reinforcement mechanisms and strategies to acknowledge successPreferred:•	experience reporting effectively to executive leadership or to a board of directors•	demonstrated track record of success in effecting change within a unionized Canadian public sector environmentPositionOrganization Change Management ConsultantWork Specifications and Requirements:Description of EngagementReporting to the Chair and working with Members of the Board, the consultant will be responsible for assessing existing change management strategies and, where appropriate, recommending the development of additional change management strategies and tactics for the implementation of The Way Forward – the final report of the Transformational Task Force.By way of background, The Way Forward and its implementation will modernize the Service through a series of recommendations endorsed by the Board, and will be the largest change project in the history of the Service. It has multiple concurrent projects with separate timelines, involving virtually every area of operation and an unprecedented range of personnel. It will redesign the organizational structure, culture, training, functions and operations of the Service from every perspectiveThe consultant will work closely with the Strategy Management Unit and The Way Forward implementation teams, and will review and, where appropriate, recommend change initiatives to ensure a successful implementation and member acceptance.Key CompetenciesThis role requires a professional with strong change management and communications skills, as well as demonstrated problem-solving and influencing capabilities. The consultant will have a strong commitment to quality and accuracy and will demonstrate the ability to recommend solutions for change management challenges with outcomes that positively impact projects.ResponsibilitiesThe successful candidate will:•	Assess existing change management strategies and, where appropriate, recommend additional strategies with measurable objectives•	Recommend measures to ensure the consistent application of a structured change management approach to process, structural and human resource issues related to The Way Forward•	Provide the Board with a holistic view of change and with an assessment of the impact of change on the effectiveness of the Toronto Police Service•	Assess existing plans and, where appropriate, recommend additional change management plans that maximize member engagement and support a comprehensive and timely implementation, while identifying and mitigating human resource-related risks and concerns•	Provide guidance to the implementation teams within the scope of change management methodologies•	Work with the implementation team to recommend the integration of change management activities into the overall project plan, and ensure that all areas that are impacted are prepared for future changes•	Identify potential human resource risks and anticipated points of resistance, and recommend project change plans to mitigate or address these concerns•	Recommend metrics to drive adoption and sustainment of change that link to the realization of project benefits; develop a measurement strategy for same•	Provide regular and ongoing status updates to the Chair and Members.•	Recommend readiness assessments, assist, where appropriate, in the evaluation of results and ensure that findings are presented in a logical and easy-to-understand manner•	Recommend reinforcement mechanisms and strategies to acknowledge success.Randstad Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach her/his potential. We welcome applications from: women, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, visible minorities, and others who may contribute to diversification.As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, Randstad Canada will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. Please contact your Randstad Recruiter/Consultant about your needs, and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

title: Business System Analyst - Permanent – 8481
description:
Business System Analyst - Permanent – 8481 | Monster.com















































 Business System Analyst - Permanent – 8481 at LRO Staffing
 
Gatineau, QC













About the Job

Business System Analyst - Permanent – 8481 About the Opportunity  Our client, a growing startup in Gatineau area, is looking for a Business System Analyst to join their team full time. This client is leading its field and has tripled its employees in just a year! The ideal candidate will have a passion for evolving company culture and the health care space. Must have a project management/ business analyst background as well as technical abilities with Systems and Databases.   About YouThe ideal candidate will have:·         Minimum 3 years of experience working as project manager or business analyst ·         Proficient technical background in testing or ERP systems ·         Designing, supporting and maintaining systems·         Strong communication skills and support skills  ·         Excellent verbal and written English and French (asset) communication skills, and ability to work both in a team and autonomous environment Attitude and aptitude takes precedence over a perfect technical match. Salary RangeSalary is commensurate on experience, and is an addition to an excellent perks/benefits package. How to Apply Please apply by clicking the “Apply” button below and follow the link to submit your résumé. You can also apply by submitting your résumé directly to . If you are already registered with us, please contact your Senior Recruiter. Please quote job 8481. Thank you for your interest in this role. One of our Recruiters will be in touch with you if your profile meets the requirements for the role and the expectations of our clients. Please note that all candidates must be permitted to work in Canada to be considered for this opportunity.   About Us With deep expertise in specialized recruitment and staffing, LRO Staffing places qualified professionals in contract, permanent and temporary roles. LRO Staffing's singular focus on finding the right fit for companies and candidates has helped organizations and individuals succeed for more than 10 years.  We specialize in placing candidates and contractors in Accounting, Finance, Technology, Law, Government Services, Human Resources, Communications, Construction and Executive Support roles.     Better jobs. Better people. Better fit.

title: Java Developer
description:
Eagle is currently seeking a Java Developer for a six (6) month contract position, scheduled to begin immediately.Key ResponsibilitiesThe successful candidate will be responsible for:Supporting a number of existing applications on various technologies;Developing and maintaining technical solutions that adhere to engineering and architectural design principles while meeting business requirements;Providing technical expertise with a focus on efficiency, reliability, scalability, and security;Planning, evaluating, recommending, designing, operationalizing, and supporting solutions in compliance with enterprise and industry standards.Skills and QualificationsThe successful candidate must have:Proficiency in Java and Scala, with a good knowledge of its ecosystems (8+ years);5 years Familiar with various design and architectural patterns; 5 years with concepts of MVC, JDBC, and RESTful; 5 years’ experience with popular web application frameworks, such as Play and Spark;5 Years good understanding of database tables and able to understand complex SQL statements; 5 years with good understanding of JSON, XML structure, XSLT transformation;5 years with Banking and financial;3+ years of experience with Source Control System including GIT and SVN and,2+ years of experience with Agile development Methodology and related tools (Confluence, Jira).Don't miss out on this opportunity, apply online today!Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

title: Hadoop Architect
description:
Full-Time Position - Toronto We're hiring a full-time Hadoop Architect in Toronto, ON! This role requires at least 5+ years’ experience architecting and delivering Hadoop solutions and 10+ years’ experience architecting and delivering BI/EDW projects.Do you have familiarity with Windows and Linux operating systems and prior experience working in a customer-facing role? If so, this Hadoop Architect could be a perfect fit for you!Perks You'll Love* Team activities (sports, entertainment, karaoke), professional development conferences* Join an Award-winning company, celebrated for its fantastic culture* Nationwide company, with over 250+ employees and in 6 locationsMain ResponsibilitiesIn the Hadoop Architect role, you will...* Meet directly with client's business users to identify project objectives and business requirements; and with client's IT users to identify technical requirements* Work within overall project plan and schedule* Provide feedback to customers and creates structured documentation, including specifications and weekly status reports* Advises client on configuration and implementation options based on best practices* Provide expertise and leads technical aspects of sales pursuits* Participate in the business requirements gathering process for client customizations* Lead/Support solution implementation, customization, testing, and deployment, including preparation of test scenarios. Oversees client user acceptance testing* Act as a technical mentor for clients in transferring solution critical knowledge* Collaborate with customer team participants* Ensure that all implementation methodology deliverables are complete and on-time* Generate timely project status, time, and expense reports as requested by managementRequired Skills & Background* At least 5+ years’ experience architecting and delivering Hadoop solutions* At least 10+ years’ experience architecting and delivering BI/EDW projects* A technical degree in computer science or engineering* Familiarity with the following operating systems: Windows and Linux* Previous experience working in a customer-facing role* Experience with Hadoop frameworks such as Hortonworks and Cloudera as well as their associated open source tools (MapReduce, Impala etc.)* Specialized experience with NiFi, Kafta, Spark, Hbase, with Scala based coding in Spark and SparkSQL* Experienced in the DevOps continuous integration lifecycle* Able to take leadership / Architecture role as needed and work as individual contributor* Experienced in Cluster configurations, tuning, troubleshooting and enterprise integration* Experience with database technology such as Vertica, Teradata, Neteeza, Microsoft SQL and Oracle* Performance tuning, systems management, backup/recovery/DR scenariosWe Are An Equal Opportunity EmployerAll qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.Canadian Work AuthorizationAll applicants MUST be authorized to work in Canada. Any applicants not meeting this criteria will not be notified and will not be considered eligible for the position.

title: Software - Infrastructure Test Lead (Web)
description:
Our client requires the services of a Software and Infrastructure Test Lead. The Software and Infrastructure Test Lead will head the test team that will be testing the System's internal and external applications. It is important that the Services be undertaken by a Software and Infrastructure Test Lead who can demonstrate specific knowledge of and experience in performing similar work for projects of a comparable nature, size and scope,This is a nine (9) month contract with a top tier organizational, scheduled to begin immediately.We’re looking for people who can: Plan and manage the testing activities required to test the new IT Solution including issue and defect tracking;Attend walkthroughs of Business Requirements Document (BRD) and Design document;Review and provide comments on the BRD and Design document (identify gaps, ambiguities, contradictions, etc.);Develop the Test Strategy, Master Test Plan and Test Completion Report and getting them approved by the Business Client;Develop individual Test Plans (as required) for each type of test (i.e. functional, integration, system, performance, security, etc.) and getting them approved by Business Client;Report the status of the tests and defects to the appropriate authority (i.e. Project Manager, Stakeholders, Business Clients, etc.);Coordinate work with other project team leads;Ensure appropriate test coverage of the IT Solution during the testing period;Report on the progress of testing to appropriate authority (i.e. Project Manager, Stakeholders, Business Client, etc.);Chair the Defect Meeting(s) during the Test Phase and Participate in the discussions about the defects at the Defect Meeting(s);Attend other project meetings as required ?Do you have?Minimum of five years' experience as a Software and Infrastructure Test Lead in large, complex projects within a web based application environment that comprises both internal and cloud components;Solid understanding of System Development Life Cycle;Demonstrated expertise in the field of quality assurance/quality control, test planning, and test execution;Extensive experience in creating test strategies for projects;Clear understanding of Business Requirements, Solution Design, Statement of Work, and Test Strategies as they apply to projects;Extensive experience in tracking problems/issues and defects within a large, complex project;Extensive experience in all facets of testing (i.e. planning, documenting, test execution, reporting, defect management and resolution) 8. Extensive experience in all types of tests (i.e. functional, accessibility, usability, system/integration, regression, configuration, recovery, security, penetration, performance and user acceptance testing) a definite asset;Strong experience in testing of Java based web application solutions in a WebSphere environment is preferred;Excellent written and verbal communication skills;Ability to work independently as well as within a team environment;University/Community College degree in Computer Science / Electronic Engineering or equivalent is a definite asset; and,Certification in Software Quality Engineering or equivalent is a definite asset.Don’t miss out on this excellent career opportunity, Give us a call now @ 1-800-281-2339 and quote Job ID# 49747 or apply online today!Eagle is an equal opportunity employer and will provide accommodations during the recruitment process upon request. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please note that your application does not signify the beginning of employment with Eagle and that employment with Eagle will only commence when placed on an assignment as a temporary employee of Eagle.

title: Product Manager
description:
Job Description: Responsibilities:• Work closely with Senior Leaders and multiple key stakeholders to develop technical implementation methods that directly align with the business strategies (i.e. delivery of a Cloud online platform).• Be able to clearly envision the end product which involves having a strong understanding of the business needs and being able to prioritize the workload accordingly amongst the team to deliver a superior product.• Thorough understanding of industry trends, regulations, market threats and competition.Required Skills & Abilities:• At least 2 years of experience with Service Architecture.• Bachelor's degree or higher (e.g. computer science, engineering).• Minimum of 7 years of experience developing and launching customer products.• Strong technical knowledge (i.e. ability to read/write code) with thorough knowledge of systems design, architecture and information security.• Strong analytical skills with excellent problem solving abilities.• Ability to think and influence strategically.• Must have exceptional communication, organization and time management skills.• Ability to manage competing priorities while adhering to strict deadlines.• Be a team player.• Think outside the box and generate viable solutions.• Exhibits the utmost discretion when dealing with highly sensitive information.• Ability to drive change from traditional application technology to banking as a service platform.Bonus Skills:• MBA or Masters in a technical field (e.g. computer science, engineering).• 2-3 years of banking/financial industry experience.Randstad Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach her/his potential. Please contact your Randstad Recruiter/Consultant about your needs, and we will consult with you to ensure suitable accommodation is provided.All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply; however, in accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

title: Senior Web Architect
description:
Sensei Labs is the newest Klick endeavour - a grand experiment in bringing the philosophies and technologies of the world's largest independent digital health agency to market for everyone else to adopt and build on. We're taking everything that's made Klick successful and packaging that magic into an awesome SaaS application and service offering. This is an opportunity to join us as we re-invent the technology of human achievement.This is not an intranet in the usual sense of the word; it's a single unified application that drives every aspect of our business and is constantly being updated with the latest cool and useful web technology. It's a recruiting platform, work orchestrator, learning environment, social media site, ERP, and data cube browser all in one, among many, many other things.I'm looking for an experienced front end architect who can create the client-side code behind our award-winning Sensei platform. From responsive websites to HTML5 presentations, we're looking for architects who can help our clients, and our platform stand out in the crowd. Responsibilities

Develops custom client side components of web pages and sites.Develops cross platform desktop, mobile and/or responsive websites.Develops cross platform mobile responsive emails.Accurately translate designs from creative department to HTML/CSS.Experiments with and evaluate new technologies.Operates independently or as a member of a team as appropriate for individual projects.
Qualifications

Experience: 5 years experience in a similar role.Education: Bachelor Degree in Computer Science5+ years developing HTML-based web content.Extensive experience with modern HTML, JavaScript, and CSS.Applied knowledge of mobile development best practices.Understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Team orientation and sparkling interpersonal skills.Experience with responsive design.
Core Skills

ERP
JavaScript
Client Side
Technology
CSS
HTML

Klick operates with a fiercely independent spirit at the intersection of technology, creativity and strategy. The Klick family is a diverse group of people who are driven and connected by a shared culture and commitment to the relentless pursuit of awesome at Klick Health, K2 Digital, Klick Learning Solutions (KLS), Katalyst, and Sensei Labs. Established in 1997, Klick has teams in Chicago, New Jersey, New York, Philadelphia, San Francisco and Toronto. Klick kicked off 2015 by being recognized for having one of the top 10 intranets in the world. In 2014, Klick won over 125 awards for its client work, corporate management and culture, including being named one of country’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, Top 10 Greatest Places to Work, Best Employers, Fastest Growing Technology Companies, and Best Managed Companies. Klick’s co-founders wrote New York Times Bestseller The Decoded Company (Portfolio/Penguin, 2014), the first book about big data in the workplace.

title: Product Application Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for platform development? Do you love not only exceeding existing client needs but also building out capabilities to stay ahead of the competition? Do you love to surprise and delight everyone in the room with cool (and useful) new features and functionality?If you answered yes – we're looking for you! We need detail oriented, architecturally strong software developers who know how to get things done. Client needs- we've got them. Aggressive platform roadmaps- we've got them too!We're looking for people who enjoy taking on big tasks, working with the team to develop a road map and want to roll up their sleeves and help write some of the best code in the business.We're not picky about what tools, languages or frameworks you know. We want to know how smart you are and what you've accomplished. Our belief is that if you have the "right stuff" learning a new language or framework is much easier than learning how to be the kind of motivated leader who will succeed here at Klick.Of course this assumes you're open-minded about the tools you use and more interested in the type and complexity of the problems you'll get to solve than the tools you'll use to solve them.That said, you'll get to work with some pretty awesome technologies. We're always experimenting with cloud services (we love AWS) like Lambda, Dynamo DB, S3, EBS and RDS. Help us find more cool stuff! Responsibilities

- End-to-end development of software platforms from design and architecture to coding, support and maintenance- Creating proofs of concept, MVPs and platform enhancements.- Provide input to technology leadership, product management and roadmaps to define deliverables and timelines.- Experiment with and evaluate new technologies and bringing some fun new ideas to the table.- Ability to triage client requests while still working towards a broader aspirational platform roadmap.
Qualifications

Experience: 4 to 7 years experience in a similar role.4+ years experience with web frameworks such as ASP.NET MVC, Node.js or Java (we mostly work in .NET).4+ years experience with databases and database applications (we primarily use Postgres).Solid understanding of programming fundamentals, development process and strategies (ie: OOP, SOA, TDD, Unit Testing).Analytic, problem-solving, and conceptual skillsTeam orientation and sparkling interpersonal skills.Ability to work in a detail-oriented fashion without losing sight of the overall picture.Ability to have fun and approach big projects with an open mind.Your head won’t explode if we talk to you about Dependency Injection.Experience with continuous integration & deployment tools.
Core Skills

Dependency Injection
Unit Testing
SOA
OOP
C#
.NET
PostgreSQL
Databases
Programming
Technology
Applications
Software

title: Web Developer
description:
The OpportunityRevolve is looking for a web developer who finds nothing as satisfying as putting their code to work and transforming client objectives into digital reality.Who You Are: You enjoy strategically pushing the digital envelope and have a voracious desire to be on top of industry trends, insights and emerging digital technologies and best practices.You are a team player who knows the importance of your individual contribution and thrive in a collaborative environment. You enjoy solving problems as part of a team of creators, catalysts and strategists. You meet deadlines, you're organized and you are a solid communicator.Bonus if you like to talk cats and/or GoT. Responsibilities

The ideal candidate:Can convert PSDs into WordPress and Drupal masterpiecesConsiders translating ideas into solid code that works - even in IE10 - their bread and butterKnows the importance of being able to multi-task and balance big and small projectsThinks on their feet in a fast-paced, dynamic and entrepreneurial environmentIs an assertive and pro-active self starter with strong interpersonal and communication skillsWill play a role in estimating budgets, scopes and efforts and can right-size their magic according to the established brief, budget and timelinesWelcomes collaboration on project strategy and UX directionIs passionate about development and has real-world experienceHas a deep understanding of responsive frameworksWill settle for no less than a well-optimized website
Qualifications

Experience: 1 to 5 years experience in a similar role.
Core Skills

Experience with prototyping tools such as Invision and Balsamiq
Cordova/PhoneGap Experience
Basic shell commands
SASS
Angular JS
Moderate Git commands knowledge
Strong object-oriented development background with experience developing a wide variety of web apps
Domain and DNS Configuration
CSS3
WordPress
Drupal
HTML 5

Additional Information

We are Revolve, one of Canada's premier branding and marketing agencies. We apply disruptive thinking to build powerful brands with purpose. We've built our reputation on our ability to reduce a complex challenge to a simple strategy. We take a nimble, entrepreneurial and collaborative approach to help build strong, memorable brands based on authenticity and creativity. Our culture is focused on making sure our clients love us and for being known in our industry as a great place to work. We measure success not by top-line revenue or number of awards, but by the success and stickiness of our clients and the tenure of our staff.Our firm is built on five core values: strategic, creative, uncomplicated, initiative and caring. They are the filters by which we hire, fire, promote and reward. These values set us apart from our competition and are the primary reason our clients love working with us.Our team of thirty-five works from a waterfront office in Bedford, Nova Scotia, but we serve clients across Canada and the US. We work hard because we love what we do. We play hard too and are fortunate to work with an awesome group who genuinely care about each other.All communications will be held in the strictest confidence. Please email a resume and an introduction to Careers@Revolve.ca by October 31st, 2016.

title: Business Analyst
Technical Support Analyst
Web Developer
description:
Business information: Therefore is a digital agency that specializes in building smart human-centric web platforms and products. Through research, strategy, design and code we make beautiful websites and mobile experiences that hundreds of thousands of people use daily. We are a one-stop web consulting firm offering - strategy, design & development services.Salary: $50,000 to $60,000 based on experience and demonstrable skills.Job Description:- Consult with clients to develop and document Website requirements- Prepare mockups and storyboards- Develop Website architecture and determine hardware and software requirements- Source, select and organize information for inclusion and design the appearance, layout and flow of the   Website- Create and optimize content for Website using a variety of graphics, database, animation and other software- Research and evaluate a variety of interactive media software products- Lead and coordinate multidisciplinary teams to develop Website graphics, content, capacity and interactivity- Plan, design, write, modify, integrate and test Website-related code- Conduct tests and perform security and quality controls- Bilingual client interaction Computer and Technology Knowledge:OS X, Linux, Windows; Sublime Text, Jira, Drush, Shell scripting, VirtualBox, Jenkins, DockerProgramming Languages and Frameworks: - Drupal 7/8- PHP5, jQuery- MySQL databases- API development and integration- SASS, PatternLab, Grunt, Gulp, Git, Bower, Vagrant - RSpec and/or Behat for testing- HTML5 / CSS3, RWD (Responsive Web Design) using Bootstrap Foundation and/or Zurb       FoundationRequirements- A bachelor's degree in computer science- Proven experience working within a team environment on complex web projects- Must speak English. French proficiency is considered a highly desirable skill- Minimum of 3 years of professional agency experience working with DrupalBenefits Work from a modern open-concept social atmosphere overlooking the city skyline from Liberty Village   Getting to work  - There are lots of ways to get to the office: bike, street car, bus,  train… Most people ride their bike to work and have less than a fifteen  minute commute.  Pet projects - Have a great  idea you want to explore? Want to learn about a new process, technology  or related discipline? We give you the flexibility and encouragement you  need to stay up-to-date and relevant.  Hardware / Software  - All of our machines are top-of-the-line. You want dual-monitor, or  even triple, no problem. We’re currently using all Apple products and  Atlassian product suite. Chairs are ergonomic high quality makes such as  Herman Miller and Steelcase -- important stuff.  Health  - We provide a unique service called Akira to our employees that  provides secure on-demand access to amazing doctors using their mobile  devices. No appointments necessary. No more waiting needlessly at the  doctors office.  Gym Membership - Gym membership in our building is free for all employees.  Stocked Kitchen - We keep the kitchen stocked with healthy snacks, drinks and of course, coffee and teas.  High-Profile Clients  - We work with amazing clients, many of which are household names. Our  projects aren’t always public facing, but are very often challenging and  complex. We work closely with our clients to build deeply integrated  platforms and products.  Conferences / Knowledge Sharing  - We attend Drupal, JavaScript, Accessibility and Content Strategy  meetups, conferences, camps and summits both local and around the world.  We also contribute through sponsorships and by doing talks.  Training and Learning  - We have accounts with lots of online learning resources. Find a new  one that we can benefit from? Let us know and we’ll hook it up.  Casual Dress Code - We’re pro’s but that doesn’t mean we need to dress like we’re bankers and lawyers
